title: Newcastle go cold on Arsenal keeper Ramsdale
creator: Paul Vegas, Tribal Football
description: Newcastle United have gone cold on signing Arsenal goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale. The England international is ready to leave the Gunners after losing his first-choice status to David Raya.
content: Newcastle United have gone cold on signing Arsenal goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale. The England international is ready to leave the Gunners after losing his first-choice status to David Raya. A move to the Magpies was mooted for Ramsdale, but Newcastle have found his 30m asking price too steep, says the Daily Mail . With FFP concerns looming, Newcastle are now seeking a cheaper alternative. Meanwhile, Ramsdale is also courting interest from Chelsea with the summer market now swinging open. This article first appeared on Tribal Football and was syndicated with permission.

title: Lewis Hamilton accused of âspinningâ George Russell head-to-head after Monaco upgrades
creator: Michelle
description: "I think he knows what he's doing..."
content: Falling 7-1 behind George Russell in qualifying and blaming that on his team-mate getting Mercedesâ new front wing in Monaco, Jamie Chadwick says Lewis Hamilton is âspinningâ the narrative. Arriving in Monaco 6-1 down on Russell in the intra-Mercedes team-mate qualifying battle, Lewis Hamilton put his latest defeat to his team-mate down to Russell running Mercedesâ new front wing in Monte Carlo. Qualifying P7, 0.08s down on Russell who was P5, Hamilton said: âI anticipated it would be difficult to outqualify George because he has the upgraded component, but itâs just great to see that we are bringing upgrades. â I already know automatically that Iâm going to lose two-tenths going into qualifying. Thatâs definitely frustrating.â Going on to declare he does ânot anticipate being ahead of George in qualifying particularly this yearâ, Hamilton was pressed on the claim with a âweâll seeâ reply. But rather than read too much into Hamiltonâs comment, Williams development driver Chadwick believes Hamilton is âspinning itâ to suit his narrative. âI think he knows what heâs doing,â Chadwick told Channel 4. âHeâs spinning it to make it sound like heâs maybe not got the upgrades this weekend which for me, Iâm not sure about because a team like Mercedes, they generally always bring upgrades to both cars. âItâs not like they need to split it between the two cars. âSo yeah, I think he should take his hat off to George. Heâs 7-1 on someone like Lewis Hamilton, which is incredible. âAnd I think Lewis is probably not happy about that, to be honest. And thatâs where that comment has come from.â ð F1 2024: Head-to-head qualifying record between team-mates ð F1 2024: Head-to-head race statistics between team-mates Hamilton did in fact not have the upgraded front wing in Monaco, one report claiming the drivers tossed a coin to decide who would run it, another by Jenson Button saying the seven-time World Champion opted not to as damaging the wing in qualifying wouldâve meant a pit lane start as he wouldâve had to revert to an old spec. Chadwick reckons Hamilton best get used to be second on the list when it comes to new Mercedes parts. âHeâs on his way out next year,â she added, âGeorge is going to be staying in that seat for what they hope is a long time so they need to keep that seat and keep George happy. âAnd obviously that might come off the back of maybe Lewis being not so happy but at the same time heâs done an incredible job, heâs smashing him.â Up on Hamilton in qualifying and race stats, Russell is also ahead of his team-mates in the Driversâ standings with 54 points to 42. Read next: Follow PlanetF1.comâs WhatsApp channel for all the F1 breaking news!

title: Chinese conglomerate Fosun International sells German private bank HAL to ABN Amro for US$731 million to boost liquidity
creator: Daniel Ren
Daniel Ren
description: The company, one of Chinaâs largest private-sector conglomerates, aims to cut its debts by 10 billion yuan (US$1.38 billion) annually in the next two to three years.
content: Shanghai-based Fosun, controlled by Chinese billionaire Guo Guangchang, announced on Tuesday that the proceeds of the sale will be used to replenish general working capital. The divestment aims at streamlining Fosunâs portfolio and âenhancing [our] asset-light operation strategyâ, the company said in a filing to the Hong Kong stock exchange. âIt also demonstrates the companyâs continuous efforts to create maximum value for its shareholders.â Fosun, which is involved in a wide range of industries including tourism, pharmaceuticals, real estate and financial services, aims to cut its debts by 10 billion yuan (US$1.38 billion) annually in the next two to three years, co-chairman Wang Qunbin said during an earnings briefing on March 28. An asset-light strategy refers to a business model under which a company has only a small amount of fixed assets on its balance sheet. â[Fosun] could dispose of more noncore assets and could even target disposing of its stake in Hainan Mining, which could generate more than enough liquidity for all of its capital market debts,â Andrew Chan, a Bloomberg Intelligence analyst, said in a research note on Tuesday. Fosun owns nearly half of Shanghai-listed Hainan Mining, which has a market capitalisation of 14.6 billion yuan. Since April 2023, Fosun has spent more than US$46 million to buy its Hong Kong-listed shares as a way of boosting investor confidence, according to Chan. He added that Fosun is comfortable with its current liquidity buffer, which still has more than US$2 billion in assets that could be disposed of to enhance liquidity. Fosun reduced its interest-bearing debts, such as bank loans and corporate bonds, by 15 billion yuan to 211.9 billion yuan in 2023, according to the companyâs annual earnings report. It posted a net profit of 1.38 billion yuan for 2023, turning around from a net loss of 831.8 million yuan a year earlier. Its revenue grew 8.6 per cent to 198.2 billion yuan. Taking over HAL will strengthen ABN Amroâs position as one of the top three wealth-management firms in Germany and increase its assets by â¬26 billion. âThis is a rare opportunity to add scale to our German activities,â ABN Amro CEO Robert Swaak said in a statement. âThe proposed acquisition will further strengthen our position and offer employees of the combined group the opportunity to play a driving role in the consolidating German market.â

title: Can You Trust Online Reviews? Apparently Not Much
creator: kiplinger@futurenet.com (H. Dennis Beaver, Esq.)
description: Consumer advocate says thereâs more deception in the world of online reviews than people realize. She recommends getting tips from friends and family instead.
content: We use them all the time â Yelp, Tripadvisor, the BBB â websites that post reviews by customers, clients and patients of all sorts of companies and health care providers. But can we trust these reviews? Are the websites that post them taking steps to assure they are legit? âNo and no,â says Kay Dean of San Jose, Calif., a former criminal investigator in the U.S. Department of Educationâs Office of Inspector General. Deanâs bad experience with a health care provider with glowing reviews led her on a journey into the expansive realm of fake online reviews. âI no longer put an ounce of trust in any online review site,â she says. She is the founder of Fake Review Watch , which she says is on the side of consumers and honest businesses and attempts to show the issues that major review platforms have with fake reviews. Subscribe to Kiplingerâs Personal Finance Be a smarter, better informed investor. Sign up for Kiplingerâs Free E-Newsletters Profit and prosper with the best of expert advice on investing, taxes, retirement, personal finance and more - straight to your e-mail. Profit and prosper with the best of expert advice - straight to your e-mail. Personal experience led to her investigation About seven years ago, Dean used stellar reviews she saw on Yelp and Google to select a medical care provider. âThe experience turned out to be the exact opposite of what was claimed on the platforms, leaving me suspicious about these reviews I had relied on. And so, drawing on my knowledge as an investigator, I began doing some digging and uncovered this medical practice was trading fake reviews with other businesses in Facebook groups.â She discovered that âthe online review world was saturated with so much deception â far more so than people realize.â Frustrated by a lack of official action against this widespread fraud, Dean created YouTube videos with case studies as real examples, which she offers to major news outlets. âThatâs been effective, but my larger goal is to highlight the culpability of tech companies and review sites that are not doing enough to protect the public. I try to educate people not to trust online reviews at all, and I attempt to rally public support for more enforcement and new legislation.â Fake reviews are very convincing I asked Dean to share the clues consumers should look for to alert them that they are reading a fake review. âIt is extremely difficult for the average consumer to discern which reviews are fake,â Dean notes, âas they can be very detailed and convincing, some written by the business itself. Iâve seen many contractor reviews with photos of work lifted off of a real estate listing in another state and thousands of Yelp reviews with content simply plagiarized from Tripadvisor written by other people, sometimes years earlier. Determining whether (a review is) real or fake often requires analyzing sets of reviewers and businesses together to see if suspicious patterns emerge indicating deception.â Dean points out that even the Better Business Bureau website âhas become polluted with review fraud, hosting plenty of fake BBB reviews. Iâve found that a robust black market exists for them, including several marketers in Facebook groups offering to sell BBB reviews. I reached out to one guy from Pakistan. He offered to sell them for $3 each!â Furthermore, she notes, the BBB site lacks transparency. âJust click on a BBB review to find out something about the reviewer. Nothing comes up. There are no photos. No last names are used, nor is there any other way of finding out who or what else the person has reviewed, or if they even exist. So while the BBB says, âTrust us,â you canât.â An industry of fake reviews Online networks, many based in India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, sell fake reviews for the BBB, Yelp, Google, Angi and many more, charging as little as 50 cents per review. They have âprogramsâ for movers, lawyers, doctors, dentists, you name it, and will create fake positive and negative reviews that appear to come from real people in cities all over America. Sites such as Reviews That Stick offer reviews across multiple platforms to boost the reputation of a business. âMuch of the fraud, though, is organized on social media sites with impunity,â Dean says, adding, âFacebook does little to stop the marketing of fake reviews. There are scores of groups on its platform that openly facilitate buying and selling them. Under Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act , however, web-hosting platforms are not responsible for this kind of illegal activity conducted by third parties.â Houston defamation attorney Paul Sternberg says, âBut when the platform itself â such as the BBB â gives an A+ rating when they know or should know from hundreds of complaints the business is misleading its customers, I believe they have opened themselves up to being sued. Even if the platform says, âWe do not endorse,â the very fact of awarding that grade â which then is used by the business in its advertising â is an endorsement.â If we canât trust online reviews, then what? Dean believes that until social media sites like Facebook and review platforms such as Google and Yelp can be held accountable for the rampant review fraud they allow to be foisted on the public, not much will change. This would require congressional action. Until then, she recommends consumers use the old-fashioned method of choosing businesses â by talking to real relatives and friends about who they would recommend. Dennis Beaver practices law in Bakersfield, Calif., and welcomes comments and questions from readers, which may be faxed to (661) 323-7993, or e-mailed to Lagombeaver1@gmail.com . And be sure to visit dennisbeaver.com . This article was written by and presents the views of our contributing adviser, not the Kiplinger editorial staff. You can check adviser records with the SEC or with FINRA .

title: How to build a capsule wardrobe â all the items you need
creator: Maisie Bovingdon
content: A CAPSULE wardrobe is a term often thrown about in the fashion business, but what is a capsule wardrobe? A capsule wardrobe is a specific selection of go-to staples you can rely on day in and day out, season after season, year after year. A capsule wardrobe is essentially a minimalist collection of clothes, that you can put together in different ways to create a simpler, more sustainable way of dressing - and easier in the mornings too - as you can mix and match those staples with other key pieces or trend items. Typically a capsule collection is a refined collection of some of your most worn pieces, your classic go-to's you can't live without, but are versatile enough to see you through every season, any occasion, year after year. Some of the most popular wardrobe staples we have in our closet - and have done for many decades - include a trusted pair of jeans, smart wide-leg trousers, classic layering items, such as T-shirts and tanks, as well as a timeless leather biker jacket or blazer. In most cases, you can wear every item in your capsule wardrobe as one complete outfit, or use it as a base to style with other garments. Pair your failsafe Levi jeans with a white t-shirt, black heeled boots, and a black leather jacket for the office, after-work drinks, brunch with friends, or your next shopping spree. Alternatively switch the white t-shirt for a more jazzy top for an evening out, either way your capsule wardrobe will be the base for many looks, save you money in the long run and leave you feeling confident and looking great. You can even pair the same jeans with. tank top and sandals for the warmer months, or a city break. The point is it is effortless, versatile and interchangeable. The best part of a capsule wardrobe is it is timeless, so if you don't have select items in your closet already they are well worthy investment pieces to see you through any occasion, season, and style. Generally, a capsule wardrobe is classic colours, and tonal hues, such as black, white, greys, navy, and camel, which can be paired with any outfit, hence why it is so popular to nail. For those who may prefer a colourful wardrobe, you can easily inject colour through other layering items, accessories, or your make-up to elevate a look and make it more personal to your style. And, if you change your style in years to come, the capsule wardrobe is still a fallback you can rely on. If you are looking to declutter your wardrobe, slim down your closet, and start to forge a capsule wardrobe, we have some handy tips to help you curate the essentials. A classic black bag is a staple, it will go with any outfit and is suitable for any occasion, day or night, year after year. You can't go wrong with this Kate Spade Pebbled Leather Tote, which can be styled not just as a shoulder bag but also as a cross-body and handbag. The pebbled black leather is an elegant choice that won't date, making it a great starting point for your capsule wardrobe and suitable for a multitude of events. It's perfect to house your laptop when heading to the office, as well as your valuables for a shopping spree. Knott Pebbled Leather Medium Crossbody tote, Â£375 Of course, jeans are a classic wardrobe essential, and while you may own a variety of styles; from skinny, to wide-leg, or flares, a straight leg in a classic blue denim wash is our top pick. If we were only to wear one pair of jeans for the rest of our lives it would have to be Levi's 501s, which complement any outfit, can be dressed up or down and are super flattering for all body types. Levis have stood the test of time, and are available in numerous waist and leg lengths to suit every body shape. From summer through to winter a pair of jeans are always a failsafe option. While we are trying to keep our capsule wardrobe to a minimum we recommend stocking up on this style in blue denim, ecru and black. 501s Levis Original Jeans, Â£100 We love a blazer more than anyone, as they are a versatile statement piece for anyone of any age, and for any occasion. Some may prefer fitted blazers, our personal favourite is an oversized design, as it is flattering, timeless, and much more versatile. You can wear your blazer over jeans and a jumper when heading to the office, over leggings and a hoodie for a quick dash to run errands, over a dress for drinks for a little more coverage, or on its own with knee-high boots, and cinched in with a belt for full-on glam. Blazers are created using various fabrics, such as wool, cotton, and linen, but we recommend a relaxed cotton design to see you all year long - as a wool blazer in summer or a linen blazer in winter isn't quite the most sensible style option. Relaxed Single Breasted Blazer, Â£69 When it comes to Autumn and Winter, a turtle neck, or roll-neck jumper is a must. They are chic, classy, timeless, formal and flattering as they elongate your arms and neck. They work as the perfect winter warmer, as you can style under a blazer, shacket, another jumper, or leather jacket. M&S has an impressive range of turtle neck designs, which also come in its signature Heatgen technology for extra warmth in the colder seasons. But come the warmer seasons you may switch to a sleeveless tank for layering. Pure Merino Wool Roll Neck Jumper, Â£35 We love a cosy knit jumper, and this & Other Stories number is a classic. A knit jumper is perfect to layer in winter, wear on its own, under a blazer or parker jacket, with jeans, leggings, a skirt, over a dress, paired with boots, trainers, you name it. But you can also keep it with you in the Spring and Summer seasons too, drape it over your shoulders so it is easy to slip on when the balmy nights turn a little chilly at those upcoming garden parties. This & Other Stories' jumpers are long-lasting, with a slightly boxy fit, so you have room to move or layer underneath. Mock Neck Sweater, Â£45 We have an entire drawer filled with T-shirts, the majority of which are classic white round-neck styles. Why? Because they go with everything. A round crew neck boxy t-shirt is a lifesaver for everyone and a non-negotiable in your capsule wardrobe. Arket's boxy style is perfect, as the short sleeves are the perfect length, the collar is not too tight or loose around the neck, and best still - the fabric is not see-through, yet not too heavy. Tuck into jeans, a skirt, or shorts, or wear over leggings, you can dress up or down, wear on its own, or layer on top. However you choose to style a white T-shirt, it will always look chic. Crew-Neck T-shirt, Â£17 If you only buy one pair of boots, make it a pair of classic black boots . One of the classics we return to time after time is a block heel ankle boot with a pointed or square toe because it goes with every outfit. You can pair this footwear must-have with jeans, a skirt and jumper for the office, and a blazer dress for weekend drinks, the possibilities are endless. Dear Frances has plenty of boot designs, but the Cube Boot is part of the Core Collection, which speaks volumes in our opinion. Cube Boot, Â£595 A cotton shirt sounds super formal but it doesn't have to be styled solely for the office with a suit. It's a must-have for those days you want to look "done" and well put together but with minimal effort. Worn with jeans and trainers, it looks classic and is a brilliant base under a chunky round knit jumper and leggings, or with smart trousers. You can even wear the shirt undone over a bralette for an evening out. Extra Fine Cotton shirt, Â£29.90 A pair of classic white trainers will never go amiss in your wardrobe. Some may prefer the timeless Converse, whether its high or low tops, Veja, the New Balance 550, or Superga's Nappa trainers or Cotu Classic, which are hugely popular with Kate Middleton. What we love is not only are they super fashionable, but they go with everything, and provide a little platform to elevate you. Pair with skirts and floral dresses in the summer, with jeans or trousers in winter and spring, as long as they are crisp and clean you will look super chic. 2740 Platform Nappa, Â£110 Over the last few years, our major obsession has been with leather trousers, faux or real, is up to you. Currently, we're loving a wide-leg leather pant, a more wearable silhouette than the PU leggings of seasons past. While they may not be the most summer-appropriate trousers, they will see you through every other season and occasion. You can pair your leather trousers with a slogan jumper, trainers and a trench coat for a casual but put-together look, with heeled boots, or a blouse and heels for evening drinks. I have lived in my straight, wide-leg, high-rise leather trousers for years, and continue to get compliments on them because they give a polished look no matter how you style them. Vegan Leather 90s Straight Pant, Â£82 A midi dress has been our firm favourite style for many years now, as it is practical, moveable and versatile. This design is suited for all ages, and suits various style preferences, as you can opt for midi shirt dresses, midi slip dresses, midi wrap dresses - and so much more. One of our personal favourites is a floral printed midi dress, like Nobody's Child, which is short-sleeved and falls midway down your calves as you can dress it up or down. Pair this number with sandals or trainers in the summer, heels for a wedding or formal occasion, or layer with a chunky knit jumper, tights and boots for the winter months. Wildflower Print Clover Midi Dress, Â£59 Linen shirts are essential when the warmer weather hits, whether that is in the balmy spring and summer seasons. If you are heading on holiday, or making the switch over from your winter wardrobe to summer, a linen shirt is paramount. You can layer over a t-shirt, tank top and jeans, or a skirt, for the daytime, or wear over a bikini for those pool days. It's lightweight and effortless, and you can even be bold by opting for a block colour such as vibrant green or bubble gum pink. Linen fabric is super gentle on the skin, and breathable, which is why it's a welcome alternative to a cotton poplin. Linen Shirt, Â£35 For shoppers looking for anything leather, or remotely biker/ rock chic inspired, Allsaints is the place to go. We have lusted after their leather jackets for longer than we can remember, and if you have yet to buy yours, now is the time to do so. We recommend an oversize biker style rather than a fitted leather, as it is more timeless, and goes with everything. Plus, the larger style, means you can wear it more if your body changes over the years. And the worn and weathered look after years of wear just makes it look cool and vintage, a win-win. Billie Oversized Leather Biker Jacket, Â£399 The LBD - also known as the little black dress - has been the iconic evening look for many years, and it is not going anywhere. A little black dress is classy and timeless, so it's no surprise it cuts our capsule wardrobe. Whether it is cotton, scuba or a satin slip dress, an LBD is a garment you will wear forever more, whether it is for a festival, drinks, or date night. You can pair it with knee-high boots, heeled boots, or stilettos, layer with a blazer or biker jacket over the top, or even opt for a t-shirt or sheer long sleeve underneath for a daytime look. The styling options know no bounds. Marlow Dress, Â£98 Wide-leg trousers have made a comeback in recent years, and we aren't mad about it. This style is flattering as the high-waisted design, and wide leg feature, means the trousers elongate your legs and skim over them so they appear longer and leaner. They are also a welcome alternative to formal smart trousers in the workplace, and jeans, which can feel a little restricting. Pleated Wide Leg trousers, Â£40 We love a trench coat in the Spring and Summer months, as well as the transitional periods between seasons. You can style it with a classic white top and jeans for a casual, yet chic, everyday look, or layer over a jumper or knitted roll neck should you wish. Some even wear over a tracksuit with a cap for those off-duty days. Premium Trench Coat, Â£51.60 (Was Â£129) A racer vest has become another wardrobe staple in recent years, and a welcome alternative to roll necks and t-shirts we wear all year round. This summer style is perfectly paired with trousers, jeans, shorts, as well as skirts, so you can get creative. What we love is River Island's design is longer length and not cropped, which some may prefer for more coverage. Plus, you can shop an unmissable deal on racer vests at River Island, which is two tops for Â£18. White Rib Racer Vest Top, Â£10 We don't feel an outfit is complete without jewellery. Over the years the resurgence of gold jewellery has proved hugely popular, and we are well on board. If you are unsure how to style gold jewellery, we recommend easing your way with a statement gold hoop, whether it is a smaller huggie or chunkier style. For those who love their accessories as much as we do, layer up with stackable rings, bracelets and bangles, as well as chokers and pendants - more is more. Missoma has a vast array of styles to shop across rings, necklaces, bracelets and earrings, so you can shop sets or individual pieces to your heart's content. Medium Chubby Hoop Earrings, Â£115 Outerwear is essential, and one coat design we see time and time again is a pea coat, tailored coat, and straight coat. It comes under numerous titles but it is a straight coat, with button front fastening, is a long line and is more structured than a trench coat. You can style it with any outfit, as it instantly elevates any look. Fawn Felt Single Breasted Coat, Â£170 New Balance trainers are the hottest footwear trend now, but what is the best style for you? Best trainers for women, these are our favourite pairs to snap up. A leather jacket has always been one of our wardrobe staples, here's where to shop the outerwear.

title: Indiaâs curry spice recalls in Singapore and Hong Kong prompt calls for tighter food safety standards
creator: Biman Mukherji
Biman Mukherji
description: Several products by Indian brands MDH and Everest in Singapore and Hong Kong were found to contain traces of harmful ethylene oxide.
content: Ethylene oxide is a colourless gas used as a pesticide and to make other chemicals. âThe issues have been sorted. We have put in place mandatory tests,â BN Jha, director of marketing at the Spices Board of India, the government regulatory and export promotion agency for Indian spices, told This Week in Asia on Monday . He noted that the contaminant was found in a consignment shipped 18 months ago and could have occurred naturally. India plans to conduct mandatory pre-shipment sample testing for six months, after which it will reassess the situation to see if there are persistent concerns. Raj Paroda, a former director general of the Indian Council for Agricultural Research, told This Week in Asia: âWe are concerned because itâs a matter of prestige and reputation. The system should be made stronger in terms of traceability and quality.â MDH and Everest, two of Indiaâs most popular spice brands, have said their products are safe for consumption. âWe do not use ethylene oxide at any stage of our spice production. Our products adhere to stringent health and safety standards,â MDH said in a statement reported by Indiaâs Mint newspaper on April 28. Following the recalls, Britainâs food watchdog applied extra control measures on all spice imports from India starting this month. Once valued more than gold and silver, Indiaâs spices trade spurred European traders to sail to the country in the 15th century. While Indiaâs spice exports remain significant, the country must overhaul its approach to food safety and public communication to boost consumer confidence, industry experts say Over 400 products from India were flagged by the European Union between 2019 and 2024 for containing contaminants, according to a report by the Indian newspaper Deccan Herald. 03:28 Indiaâs beloved butter chicken dish is at centre of court case probing who invented it Smita Sirohi, a former agriculture adviser to the Indian embassies in Belgium, Luxembourg and the EU, said Indian authorities had tightened preventive measures to remove any residue from ethylene oxide. âI am surprised why similar steps were not taken for other markets since they had taken them earlier for the EU,â Sirohi said, referring to the recent cases in Hong Kong and Singapore. âCertainly it will have a damaging impact,â recalling how EU importers had cautioned about Indian spice consignments in earlier cases. India exports US$4 billion of more than 200 spices and value-added products to some 180 countries annually while the countryâs domestic market is the worldâs largest at US$10 billion, the Spices Board of India has estimated. The sheer variety of Indian spices makes it hard for traders to trace within the supply chain to the relevant farms, Sirohi said. Farmers typically send their spices to traders for aggregation and shipment in wholesale markets. Large factories would receive supplies from these markets, and contamination can occur potentially at each step of the supply chain, according to Sirohi. Though mandatory testing can show the presence of chemicals exceeding certain legal thresholds, the problem could only be resolved by assessing the stage of initial contamination in the supply chain, Sirohi said. Authorities also need to establish guidelines for chemical use and tighten food safety processes, she added. Indiaâs health ministry has said the country applies one of the worldâs strictest standards for capping residual pesticides through rigorous risk assessments. But the cases in Hong Kong, Singapore and Europe show food safety processes and oversight in India need further strengthening, industry players say. Ruchit G Garg, founder and CEO of Harvesting Farmer Network, an agriculture technology platform, said India needed to establish excellent food safety standards. âOur spices [and agricultural products] may or may not have had traces but our track record isnât very good and our farming practices arenât very organic,â he said. 02:27 One family, one polling station: remote Himalayan villagers cast votes in Indian general election âIndia needs to invest heavily in fixing its reputation to produce healthy, chemical-free agricultural products. It has a long reputation of producing chemical-rich food, much beyond the safe limits defined by many countries.â One market analyst said there could be a spillover adverse impact on other Indian products beyond spices. âThe fact that these two brands failed [to meet quality norms] does not speak well of them and could have a wider impact on other Indian brands,â said Lloyd Mathias, a Delhi-based angel investor and business strategist. âIndian standards have to be on a global benchmark. One cannot afford to have different standards. There can be absolutely no compromise on safety,â he said.

title: BofA sees trend followers likely to sell USD this week
creator: Investing.com
content: Bank of America (BofA) released a report forecasting that Commodity Trading Advisors (CTAs), known as trend followers, are expected to sell the US dollar (USD) in significant amounts this week. The report suggests that these traders are likely to buy European Euro (EUR), British Pound (GBP), Australian Dollar (AUD), Japanese Yen (JPY), Mexican Peso (MXN), and Canadian Dollar (CAD) in response to movements in the currency markets. BofA's model indicates that the extent of USD selling by CTAs will correlate with the currency's declines. The more pronounced the drop in the USD's value, the greater the volume of USD that trend followers are expected to sell. This trend is underscored by the recent weakening of the JPY, which has returned to levels that previously triggered intervention by the Bank of Japan. The beginning of next week is marked by a bank holiday in both the United States and the United Kingdom, which BofA notes could lead to reduced liquidity in the foreign exchange (FX) markets. This environment of lower liquidity might leave the FX markets more vulnerable to larger movements should there be any substantial trading flows. This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

title: Exclusive: Third most expensive player in history now available from Aston Villa for just Â£8m
creator: Jason Pettigrove
description: The third most expensive player in football history, Philippe Coutinho, has ended his loan spell at Al Duhail and will return to Aston Villa. However, according to CaughtOffside sources with knowledge of the situation, the English club and Unai Emery donât consider him as part of their plans and are already working to let him [...]The post Exclusive: Third most expensive player in history now available from Aston Villa for just Â£8m appeared first on CaughtOffside.
content: However, according to CaughtOffside sources with knowledge of the situation, the English club and Unai Emery donât consider him as part of their plans and are already working to let him go â temporarily or permanently â during the summer. Aston Villa to cash in on Phillipe Coutinho At the moment, the big obstacle to a definitive farewell seems to be his contract at Villa Park, which runs until 2026. Coutinho is unwilling to lose money on his Â£135k per week deal by negotiating an early termination of the agreement. Aston Villa, for their part, have set what they consider a fair price for him of around Â£6m-Â£8m. Whilst that paltry figure shows how far his stock has fallen, it has piqued the interest of various clubs around the world. Among those are some teams from Qatar and elsewhere in the Middle East, who could decide to bring him back there in the summer. Vasco da Gama are also very interested in him and have already started to talk with the Brazilian player. At the moment, however, Vasco consider the costs of the possible operation too high, when adding the amount of a transfer to the salary requested by Coutinho. In any event, Aston Villa, to lighten their wage bill, are also willing to consider a loan but continue to hope that a club will take Coutinho on a permanent basis.

title: GlycoNex and PrecisemAb Sign Technology Licensing Agreement to Advance Development of Novel Anti-Glycan Antibodies for Cancer Therapy
description: GlycoNex to advance development of novel pro-antibody cancer drugs that enhance tumor suppression while minimizing off-site binding to healthy tissues to improve safety and tolerability NEW TAIPEI CITY, Taiwan, May 28, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- GlycoNex (4168, hereinafter referred to as GNX),...
content: NEW CITY, , /PRNewswire/ -- GlycoNex (4168, hereinafter referred to as GNX), a clinical stage biotechnology company focused on the development of glycan-directed cancer immunotherapies, and PrecisemAb today announced a technology licensing agreement to develop a new generation of an anti-glycan antibody drugs aimed at increasing antibody specificity, reducing drug side effects, and enhancing treatment outcomes for a variety of solid tumors. Under the agreement, GlycoNex will license PrecisemAb's Universal Antibody Lock (UAL) technology platform, which modifies antibodies to inhibit their activity until activated by tumor proteases. Deploying UAL in conjunction with GlycoNex's anti-glycan antibody platform offers the potential to improve antibody drug behavior by enabling precise therapeutic effects on tumors, while enhancing the safety and tolerability of such drugs by reducing side effects caused by on-target, off-site binding. "We are excited to collaborate with PrecisemAb and integrate the company's Universal Antibody Lock technology into our platform for developing anti-glycan antibodies targeting cancer-related glycoproteins," stated Dr. , CEO of GlycoNex. "Our goal is to develop drugs capable of selectively activating in the tumor microenvironment, precisely targeting and killing tumor cells, while remaining inactive in the circulatory system and normal tissues, thereby reducing drug side effects and improving patient quality of life." Dr. , Chairman of PrecisemAb, commented: "It is an honor to collaborate with leading glyco-biotech company, GlycoNex, in the development of innovative cancer treatments with anti-glycan antibodies. By applying PrecisemAb's Universal Antibody Lock technology, we aim to develop anti-glycan antibodies that offer patients safer treatment options." The Universal Antibody Lock technology was invented by Professor Tain-Lu Cheng's team at Kaohsiung Medical University and exclusively licensed to PrecisemAb. This technology can be widely applied in the fields of monoclonal antibody drugs, antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), and bispecific antibodies, with a production process similar to that of conventional antibodies. The UAL platform is protected by patents in 18 countries. GlycoNex has 20 years of expertise in researching tumor-specific glycans and developing cancer-targeting antibody drugs. The Company is currently conducting international clinical trials for its own new drugs and biosimilars, including its lead program, GNX-102, which targets tumor-associated glycans and has demonstrated promising results in clinical trials to date. GlycoNex Inc. is a clinical-stage biotechnology company focused on the development of glycan-directed cancer immunotherapies that effectively inhibit tumor growth while minimizing side effects. GlycoNex possesses a robust pipeline led by GNX102, a humanized monoclonal antibody (mAB) designed to target abnormal sugar molecules in cancer cells. GNX-102 has successfully completed Phase 1 clinical trials with data demonstrating excellent safety and promising efficacy. GlycoNex is also advancing a portfolio of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) that precisely attack cancer cells while sparing healthy tissue. GlycoNex is headquartered in New Taipei City, . For more information, visit . SOURCE GlycoNex, Inc.

title: How Chelseaâs style of play could evolve under Enzo Maresca
creator: Ben Fleming
description: A new era begins at Stamford Bridge.
content: Chelsea are closing in on the appointment of Enzo Maresca â but what style of play can fans expect from the highly rated Italian coach? Having guided Leicester City to the Championship title last season, Maresca appears to have topped Chelseaâs shortlist to replace the outgoing Mauricio Pochettino after Roberto De Zerbi and Kieran McKenna were also considered by the Bluesâ hierarchy. Chelsea will need to pay around Â£10million in compensation but hope to have the Italian appointed by the end of the week. The 44-year-old will inherit a young and bloated Chelsea squad but one that did show promise towards the end of the season as they finished sixth to secure a return to European football. Following his retirement from the professional game in February 2017, which saw him play for the likes of Juventus and Sevilla, Maresca went straight into coaching. He enjoyed a stint as an assistant manager at West Ham under Manuel Pellegrini before being appointed as Manchester Cityâs Elite Development Squad manager in 2020. âManuel [Pellegrini] was the person who convinced me to try to become a coach when I decided to finish playing,â Maresca said. âSo, I always say that in terms of an experience about football, Manuel for me is like a father. âIf I had some doubt, to be honest he helped me a lot as a player and in the last two years when I worked with him when he was manager at West Ham, and I have a tremendous relationship with him. âI was still working like a player with him and one day during a chat with him he said: âYou know when you finish as a player you should try to become a coach because I think you can be a good coach.â Maresca enjoyed immediate success in his first season at City, guiding the team to the Premier League 2 title before leaving to join Parma at the end of the season. His time in Serie B was far from successful, though, and the Italian was sacked after just 14 games and he ended up returning to City in the summer of 2022 as one of Guardiolaâs assistants. âUnfortunately, it didnât go as I hoped,â Maresca said of his short stint at Parma. âWe signed 14 new players, it was a young team with an international environment, I was training in four languages, and it wasnât so quick to get certain concepts across. âThe start was difficult and from the outside there was a tendency to always see the glass as half empty. It ended after 13 games and I was very sorry, I still think we were on the right track.â Last summer, Maresca was appointed as Dean Smithâs replacement at Leicester and guided the Foxes straight back to the top flight after a superb season in the Championship. Despite a disappointing tenure at Parma, Marescaâs impressive spell at Leicester and attractive style of play has caught the eye of many over the last year. The former City assistant helped Leicester pick up 97 points en route to the title, with his side boasting the best defensive record in the league. In addition, Maresca oversaw a total overhaul of the teamâs style of play, turning Leicester into a possession-focused team, a philosophy and play style that is said to have appealed to the Chelsea hierarchy. âHeâs by far the best manager Iâve worked for,â Leicester City midfielder Harry Winks told Sky Sports in March. âHeâs incredible. I think everybody will say heâs going right to the top in [terms of] managerial stature. Heâs got everything. âHeâs a great man-manager. Heâs tactically incredible, some of the decisions that he tells us to do before the game and how he views the match is something Iâve never experienced before in football. âSo, yeah, itâs opened my eyes a lot to football in the way itâs played and the kind of Pep Guardiola style as well, I know he worked with for a long time. âIâm loving my football, it works perfectly for me. Itâs exactly the kind of football that I want to play and buy into. âI think since he has come in, Iâve learned so much and continue to do that.â Maresca values control of the ball and positional play above all else. In the Championship, Leicester were known for their patient and possession-heavy build-up but this did not come at the expense of goalmouth action, with Leicester scoring 89 goals throughout the season â a tally only bettered by Ipswich. Maresca likes to involve his goalkeeper as a key cog in their intricate build-up from the back and also uses inverted full-backs to help with ball retention in central midfield. A deep-lying playmaker â as opposed to a more physical defensive midfielder â is preferred at the base of midfield to help recycle possession, with the other midfielders expected to push forward and make runs in behind the oppositionâs defence. With full-backs operating infield, Maresca likes his forwards to stay high and wide in attack, although the central striker often drops deep to aid build-up. When they lose the ball, Maresca wants his side to press quickly and high to try and regain the ball, before dropping back into a 4-4-2, with a central midfielder pushing up alongside the striker to try and win the ball back. âWhen you go out on the pitch you know exactly what to do and how the opposition are going to operate and what you can do to affect that,â Winks said in an interview with talkSPORT this season. âTo do it so simply is the most important thing. Thatâs a thing a lot of managers probably struggle with, getting the message across, but the gaffer does it so well here.â Maresca favoured a 4-3-3 formation at Leicester, although he has used a 4-2-3-1 as well at points. Robert Sanchezâs ball-playing capabilities could see him return as first-choice goalkeeper, while Levi Colwill and Wesley Fofanaâs pace and passing attributes make them a potentially exciting centre-back partnership. Pochettino used Marc Cucurella as an inverted full-back towards the end of last season and the Spaniard could continue there under Maresca. Reece James often played in central midfield for Wigan during his loan spell in 2018/19 and could be deployed in a similar role on the right side. Man Utd star told Erik ten Hag he did not want to play in FA Cup final Former Chelsea player set to return as part of Enzo Maresca's coaching staff Gary Lineker questions if Man Utd star faked injury to get out of FA Cup final Arsenal miss out on Pot 1 for Champions League draw next season Moises Caicedo may be tasked with the playmaking role at the base of midfield, with Enzo Fernandez allowed a greater license to get forward. Cole Palmer may start further back in central midfield under Maresca, but the Italianâs play style should still allow Chelseaâs standout performer this season to flourish in advanced positions. In attack, Christopher Nkunkuâs all-round capabilities could afford him a second chance after a wretched injury-affected first campaign at Stamford Bridge, while Noni Madueke and Mykhailo Mudrykâs pace and dribbling abilities make them obvious candidates to start out wide. For more stories like this, check our sport page . Follow Metro Sport for the latest news on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . MORE : Edu explains Arsenal transfer approach and makes cryptic Manchester City comment MORE : Newcastle United respond to Arsenal asking price for Aaron Ramsdale MORE : Gary Lineker risks upsetting Erik ten Hag again as he names his âpossibleâ replacement at Manchester United Chelsea news, exclusives and analysis

title: Binge Eating Disorder Market to Accelerate Substantially During the Study Period (2020-2034) | DelveInsight
description: The growth of the binge eating disorder market is expected to be mainly driven by increasing prevalence, advancements in diagnosis, the launch of emerging therapies, and an upsurge in the geriatric population. LAS VEGAS, May 28, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- DelveInsight's Binge Eating Disorder...
content: , /PRNewswire/ -- DelveInsight's report includes a comprehensive understanding of current treatment practices, binge eating disorder emerging drugs, market share of individual therapies, and current and forecasted market size from 2020 to 2034, segmented into 7MM [ , the EU4 ( , , , and ) and the , and ]. Discover which therapies are expected to grab the major binge eating disorder market share @ Binge eating disorder is a serious mental health condition characterized by recurrent episodes of consuming large quantities of food in a short period while feeling a loss of control over eating behavior. Unlike bulimia nervosa, individuals with binge eating disorder typically do not engage in compensatory behaviors such as purging or excessive exercise to counteract the binge eating episodes. Several factors contribute to the development of binge eating disorder, including genetic predisposition, psychological factors like stress or low self-esteem, and environmental influences such as societal pressure to attain certain body ideals. Traumatic life events, childhood experiences, and dysfunctional family dynamics may also play a role in its onset. Symptoms of binge eating disorder include eating unusually large amounts of food in a specific time frame, eating rapidly until feeling uncomfortably full, eating alone due to embarrassment over food intake, and experiencing feelings of guilt, shame, or distress after binge eating episodes. Individuals with BED often struggle with emotional regulation and may use food as a coping mechanism to deal with stress, anxiety, or depression. Diagnosing binge eating disorder involves a comprehensive assessment by a healthcare professional, including a physical examination, psychological evaluation, and discussion of eating habits and behaviors. Criteria outlined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5) are used to determine if someone meets the diagnostic criteria for BED. The binge eating disorder epidemiology section provides insights into the historical and current binge eating disorder patient pool and forecasted trends for the 7MM. It helps recognize the causes of current and forecasted patient trends by exploring numerous studies and views of key opinion leaders. The binge eating disorder market report proffers epidemiological analysis for the study period 2020â2034 in the 7MM segmented into: Treatment for binge eating disorder is centered around tackling the intricate issues linked with repeated episodes of overeating, often marked by a feeling of being unable to control one's eating habits. Therapeutic strategies, like cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) or dialectical behavior therapy (DBT), are commonly utilized to address the underlying emotional and psychological aspects. Additionally, nutritional guidance and encouragement are offered to encourage healthier eating habits, while medication, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), may be prescribed in certain instances. The primary objective is to assist individuals in managing their binge eating tendencies, enhancing their emotional state, and establishing sustainable lifestyle adjustments to facilitate long-lasting recovery. is the only medication approved by the FDA specifically for addressing binge eating disorders. Operating as a precursor to amphetamine, Vyvanse boosts neurotransmitter levels such as dopamine and norepinephrine in the brain, affecting impulse control and appetite management. Clinical studies have validated its effectiveness in diminishing binge eating occurrences and ameliorating associated psychological symptoms. Nonetheless, Vyvanse carries potential side effects like sleeplessness, heightened heart rate, and anxiety. Its prescription is typically reserved for situations where psychotherapy alone might not suffice, underscoring the importance of a holistic approach to treating binge eating disorder that integrates both pharmaceutical and therapeutic measures. , categorized as a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), isn't directly endorsed by the FDA for treating binge eating disorders, yet it has demonstrated effectiveness in certain instances. Despite not being formally approved for this purpose, fluoxetine is sometimes prescribed off-label to tackle the emotional and psychological aspects linked with binge eating. Through elevating serotonin levels in the brain, fluoxetine potentially aids in mood regulation and diminishing the occurrence of binge eating episodes. However, its efficacy can differ from person to person. title: Even Scarlett Johansson Needs Protection From OpenAI
creator: Hassan Ali Kanu
description: The high-profile dispute is another example of risks posed by unregulated AI development, and how little AI companies care.
content: A couple of weeks ago, shortly before it became apparent that Congress wonât be regulating the rapid development of AI technology anytime soon, the leading avatar for chatbots and other generative AI tools, Sam Altman, showed us all the true face of Big Tech and Silicon Valley, once again. Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, tweeted out a single wordââherââon May 13, as the companyâs engineers demonstrated the capabilities of its latest AI-powered voice assistant model, ChatGPT-4o, on a livestream. The message was a clear reference to the uncanny resemblance between the assistantâs voice and the voice of a real, live, and very identifiable woman, actress Scarlett Johansson, who played an AI assistant that forms a romantic and sexual relationship with a human in the movie . The intentional decision to employ a flirtatious female voice on a that will probably become near-ubiquitous one day was questionable enough. But days later, Johansson implied in a that OpenAI may have simply stolen her voice, or created a fake facsimile, after she rejected an offer to work for the company. OpenAI has that the voice was meant to sound like Johansson, and produced records showing it hired a different actressâalthough itâs also true that the company telegraphed repeatedly that its new feature was inspired by , and intimated that Johansson agreed to let the company use her voice. The move came days before Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) closed several months of with tech CEOs by announcing a âroadmapâ that calls for billions in government spending on further AI research and development, and . A group of academics, tech accountability, and civil rights groups responded with a , explaining that researchers, labor organizations, and other public-interest groups âwere marginalized in the conversation,â while âsome of the loudest and most-self serving voices from the industry,â including Altman, Elon Musk, and Marc Andreessen, had lawmakersâ ears. âAny legislative process that begins with industry in the driverâs seat is fated not only to fail the public interest, but even to exacerbate AIâs ongoing harms,â the group said in the May 20 report. The dispute between OpenAI and Johansson is a neat distillation of the cluelessness, the soft bigotry, and the apathy with which the titans of industry and Big Tech conduct themselves as they develop what are widely expected to become the most world-altering, and dangerous, technologies in human history. The case also involves overt sexism and bias, which has been a of AI applications in the past. And as much as anything, itâs a clear indication of the industryâs willingness and ability to unfairly exploit and abuse the labor of even the most powerful, well-off workers in our society. Kate Devlin, a lecturer in AI and society at Kingâs College London and author of , said the companyâs offer to Johansson was a very deliberate choice to align its vision and products with the imagined future in âi.e., people substituting interaction with attentive computers for human relationships, and even falling in love with them. The movie, incidentally, was a depiction of dystopia, not a love story. âThis is despite years of criticism about the reductive and unhelpful predominance of female voices for subservient virtual assistants,â Devlin added. âSex sells, and OpenAI knows they can get a lot more engagement with a persona for their model that coos and giggles at your every command.â Suresh Venkatasubramanian, a Brown University professor who participated in the discussions with CEOs and Congress, said the dispute shows the need for immediate regulation, so there are rules in place to protect the public while companies are debuting AI products and experimenting with the emerging technology. âThey did this with a fair amount of impunity,â Venkatasubramanian said. âThe idea that âyou do this first and if someone complains weâll see what happensâ is very much the ethos of a lot of what happens in this area for a while now. This is just an attention-grabbing example.â OpenAI did not respond to a request for comment. that she received an offer âto voice the current ChatGPT systemâ last September, which was around the same time that Altman said publicly that is his about AI, during a demo and Q&A session at a customer relationship management conference. The movie âinspired us,â and âcertainly more than a little bit,â Altman said. Reporters the resemblance during the demo between the so-called âSkyâ voice and Johanssonâs, all the way back in September 2023. Johansson declined OpenAIâs initial offer; and she never responded to a renewed offer from Altman this month, two days before the release of ChatGPT-4o, according to her statement. Yet, despite the lack of consent, the new voice assistant feature dropped last week, alongside Altmanâs âherâ tweet, and with a voice âso eerily similarâ to Johanssonâs that her âclosest friendsâ could not tell the difference, the actress said in her statement. Whatever else might be said about its portrayal of the future, is a movieâan expression of human imagination meant to tell a story and to maybe say something about life and living. On the other hand, Altman is a real guy, whose company apparently ignored a real womanâs denial of consent, and capitalized on her likeness and on-screen personas (her labor, in other words) in the real world. Most people probably understand on an intuitive level exactly what OpenAI and Altman were doing. Research suggests that casting actors who are known mainly for voice acting into voiceover roles allows filmmakers to take advantage of the starâs on-screen persona(s). In this case, we have an actress who is well known as a sex symbol, and whose on-screen personas, including in , have been described as â ,â and â â by film critics. In short, by âcasting Johansson as Samantha, the film allows us to associate Samantha with how Johansson looks, thereby giving Samantha a âphantomâ sexual presence,ââ according to by Devlin, at Kingâs College, and others. Similarly, by trying to âcastâ Johansson, and by using a similar voice, OpenAI apparently sought to imbue its product with those same qualities, in order to entice more customers. Itâs quite a move for a company whose technology is expected to help form the AI infrastructure on Apple and Microsoftâs ubiquitous devices. Itâs also worth noting that OpenAI was criticized by in December for having an all-male and all-white board, and for nominating Larry Summers, who of sexist remarks. The company to its board in March. Venkatasubramanian said he was struck by how AI companies evade responsibility for their design choices. âOn one hand, they convey the impression that what theyâre doing is like sci-fi, alien and completely different from anything ever done before,â he said. âThey do that through the voice thatâs been described as âflirty,â and by cryptically referring to the movie. These are deliberate choices. But when confronted they tend to back off and say we didnât mean that.â are no less worrisome. As a background matter, the âmagicâ behind AI often includes . OpenAI, a company worth billions, has to Kenyan workers making less than $2 an hour. The development points to how AI threatens a broad range of professions, including white-collar or so-called knowledge workers, and even the most powerful in our society. Johansson chose not to work for Altman and OpenAI; still, the company was able to use its huge public profile and its technology to reap much of the attention and other benefits that it would have gained if Johansson decided to sign a contract with them. Johansson has said that the company only took down the âSkyâ voice after she was forced to hire legal counsel, and itâs likely she will pursue the apparent violations of her publicity rights. She may have a good case with some precedent: Going back to the 1980s, artists like and , who are famous for their distinctive, recognizable voices, have successfully sued companies that hired people to impersonate their voices for commercial use. The Midler case went all the way to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals, which ruled that a famous voice is distinctive enough that an imitator cannot be used in a commercial enterprise without consent and approval. The dispute also parallels more recent circumstances, when the popular artist Drake released a song that relied on AI to generate the voice of the late Tupac, who remains one of the best-selling artists within the genre. Lawyers representing the late rapperâs estate sent a letter saying their client âwould never have given its approval,â and was dismayed by the âflagrant violation of Tupacâs publicityâ rights and âthe legacy of one of the greatest hip-hop artists of all time.â The song was scrubbed from social media after the threat of legal action. Ironically, was the victim of a possible publicity rights violation in April, when a content creator uploaded a new song believed to have featured AI-generated vocals from Drake and The Weeknd. At the time, the artistsâ label, Universal Music Group, made the stakes clear in a statement condemning AI-generated content that infringes on publicity rights: The issues raise a question as to which side of history these companies want to be on, UMG said: âthe side of artists, fans and human creative expression, or on the side of deep fakes, fraud and denying artists their due compensation,â a UMG spokesman in a statement reported by NPR. UMG has artificial-intelligence platforms over using its copyrighted works to âtrainâ models; and other major businesses, like , the , and a host of other publications, have filed lawsuits against companies like OpenAI and Microsoft. OpenAI had to have known about these controversies before deciding to rip off Johanssonâs likeness. And yet it wasnât a deterrent to the multibillion-dollar company. , or the fast-growing category of work known as content creation, is uniquely vulnerable to artificial intelligence. In a sense, content creators, who are effectively contract workers for social media platforms, often lack and conditions of their employmentâthe algorithmic systems that handle ranking and content moderation. The dispute with Johansson is simply a high-profile example of the power Big Tech and AI companies wield. Of course, the dispute also demonstrates a kind of cluelessness in the industry, much like the that showed a hydraulic machine crushing a trumpet, piano, books, and other instruments of creativity and imagination, and replacing them with the latest iPad. (Apple pulled the ad and apologized after receiving major backlash.) Polls show that most Americans donât trust companies to use and develop AI responsibly. A recent Pew Research Center showed that 70 percent of Americans say they have âlittle to no trust in companies to make responsible decisions about how they use AI in their products,â and 80 percent said the information companies collect in the process âwill be used in ways that people are not comfortable with.â Still, industry leaders are trying to sell us on a vision of the future and of AI focused on deep relationships with flirty, attention-trapping computers that sound like Scarlett Johansson, which will also read our children and make things like musical instruments and pencils obsolete. Itâs almost laughable, until you remember the actual stakes at hand when it comes to AI, and the fact that these companies are still unregulated in the U.S.

title: ELECTION 2024: Solicitor faces challenge from Columbia attorney
creator: DIONNE GLEATON T&D Staff Writer
description: In his quest for a sixth term, 1st Circuit Solicitor David Pascoe, a Democrat, is facing a challenge in the June 11 primary.
content: In his quest for a sixth term, 1st Circuit Solicitor David Pascoe, a Democrat, is facing a challenge in the June 11 primary. Columbia attorney Austin Drake Nichols is making a bid for the office. The 1st Judicial Circuit includes Orangeburg, Dorchester and Calhoun counties. Party primaries will be held June 11 with any runoff scheduled for June 25. The general election is Nov. 5. Pascoe was first elected in 2005 as solicitor for the 1st Judicial Circuit. "Being a prosecutor has been a calling my entire adult life. It is all I've wanted to do even before law school. A prosecutor's duty is to seek justice in every case and protect the rights of both victims and defendants," the 57-year-old said. "I take this role very seriously since a prosecutor is the only person in the judicial system whose job is to do 'justice.' Other than being a father to three amazing sons, being solicitor is both the most important and only job I desire waking up to every morning," said Pascoe, who is married. Pascoe said his office would seek justice, something which he has experience in. "Having done it for 30 years and having prosecuted corrupt politicians at the Statehouse, I am in a unique position which is allowing me to call out selfish and corrupt behavior when their actions impede the fairness of our justice system," he said. Pascoe was assigned as a special prosecutor in a public corruption probe of the General Assembly in 2014. He oversaw the investigation and secured the convictions and office removals of five state General Assembly members, including the House speaker, Senate president pro tem, House Judiciary chairman and two former House majority Leaders. "I have the experience in bringing diversion programs to our circuit by establishing drug courts and a Youth Mentor Program, which has been recognized as best in the state. I am currently in the process of getting a youth program implemented to deal with our current statewide epidemic of guns in the hands of our children," Pascoe said. The Youth Mentor Program was the first of its kind in the 1st Circuit to target youth juvenile violence by linking the judicial system with the local faith community, the solicitor said. He continued, "My office has been working with Orangeburg County Sheriff Leroy Ravenell and the Orangeburg County Sheriff's Office for several months now to come up with a program that will be operational very soon." Pascoe said the difference between him and his opponent is that he brings more "experience, results and commitment to the community." "I have 30 years prosecutorial experience and successfully tried over 200 violent crime cases. My opponent has none. I have created drug courts and diversion programs in our circuit. My opponent has no such experience. Finally, I live in the circuit and raised three sons in Calhoun and Orangeburg counties. My opponent was not even registered to vote in the district when he filed to fun," he said. Pascoe is a 1989 magna cum laude graduate of The Citadel. He graduated from the University of South Carolina School of Law in 1993. He worked as a state prosecutor with both the 5th Circuit Solicitor's Office and Attorney General's Office after graduating law school. As an assistant solicitor, he was profiled on Court TV for the guilty verdict of Jeffery Weston, one of the state's only murder trials where the victim's body has never been discovered. As solicitor, he said he again successfully prosecuted a "no body" murder case in Orangeburg County, securing the murder conviction of Kenneth Cutter. Pascoe also cited the life sentences given to two men responsible for the murder of 6-year-old Winston Hunter of Woodford. Nichols is an attorney with the The Rutherford Law Firm LLC, 1315 Blanding, Columbia, SC 29202. The 29-year-old Anderson native said he now resides in Calhoun County and that questions surrounding his residency are unfounded. According to filing information with the South Carolina Election Commission dated April 1, 2024, Nichols lists his address as 1708 Bridge St. in St. Matthews. "I reside right on Bridge St. in Calhoun (County). If I didn't reside in the county, I wouldn't have been eligible to even apply to run. It's another attack just because I'm young and haven't been out of law school much. So I've moved around," Nichols said. He said he is also registered to vote at the same place. "You can't be registered to vote somewhere else and run somewhere else," he said. He said he wants to accomplish two things if elected. "One, I want to be able to prosecute cases for the whole circuit. That is going to include making sure that from top to bottom -- myself included and everyone in the office -- is trained and skilled. Not saying that they aren't now, but that we continue to be intentional about polishing up our skills and polishing up our trial advocacy and studying, growing and developing that so that we're strong and effective when we're in the courtroom," Nichols said. He continued, "But like I keep saying, particularly for Orangeburg, it's a college town, it's a college community. There's a lot of young people in the 1st Circuit, and I wanted to get young people back involved in service, back involved in wanting to be in law enforcement, go to law school and be a lawyer, work in the victim's advocate office, work in some type of role with city, town, county and state government." Nichols said he wants to "encourage our youth and encourage young people to be civil servants." "We're going to do that through the good work and through the hard work that we do while we're having fair, common sense and strong prosecution, but also making sure that we're touching the community," he said. He joined the firm of SC House Minority Leader Todd Rutherford of Richland County in August 2023. "I do a lot of civil litigation all over the state. I'm licensed in both South Carolina and in D.C. I do some criminal defense, as well," Nichols said. He is a graduate of Westside High School in Anderson. "I just had a little brother and niece graduate from Westside. I went to Coastal Carolina for undergrad, was student body president there and then went to law school at (the University of South) Carolina," he said, noting that he got his undergrad degree in political science, with a minor in ancient philosophy. He was married in April. "It has been an extremely busy spring for me. No children, just a lot of nieces and nephews, and no animals, yet, but hopefully I can convince her to get one when this is said and done," Nichols said. As far as his campaign, he said it's not all about winning. "At the end of the day in this race, we're all Democrats. ... Whether I win, or Mr. Pascoe wins this primary, I am certain that either of us will do a great job. Either he'll continue to do a great job, or I will do a great job. But we've got to continue to support Democrats along this journey, and we've got to continue to uplift people of the 1st Circuit, particularly our young people." Contact the writer: dgleaton@timesanddemocrat.com or 803-533-5534. Follow "Good News with Gleaton" on Twitter at @DionneTandD The Democratic primary race for 1st Judicial Circuit solicitor turned contentious during a May 22 candidate forum. title: Orangeburg man accused of stalking ex
creator: MARTHA ROSE BROWN T&D Staff Writer
description: Orangeburg Department of Public SafetyA 25-year-old Orangeburg man is accused of stalking a woman and causing her to fear for the safety of her and her family, according to a warrant.
content: A 25-year-old Orangeburg man is accused of stalking a woman and causing her to fear for the safety of her and her family, according to a warrant. Gabriel Kimani Berry, of Wolfe Trail, is charged with stalking. Berryâs ex-girlfriend claims he has been harassing and stalking her for about two months. She fears that the alleged incidents wonât stop until Berry kills her, according to the incident report. She told officers she hadnât left her residence in a week because she was afraid sheâd encounter Berry. A warrant accuses Berry of using a pattern of words and conduct âthat served no legitimate purpose and was intended to causeâ his accuser âfear of bodily injury and/or death of herself and her family.â It goes on to accuse Berry of: â¢ Calling and texting his exâs phone, threating to âsmack the f - - -â out of her with one of his guns. â¢ Driving by his exâs residence and vandalizing her property. â¢ Displaying a weapon and posting his exâs whereabouts on social media. â¢ Threatening his ex and her mother on Facebook. Berry was taken into custody on May 21. Orangeburg Municipal Judge Chasity Avinger did not set bail on Berry on Wednesday, leaving that matter to be considered by a circuit judge later. If Berryâs convicted, he faces up to five years in prison and a $5,000 fine. Contact the writer: mbrown@timesanddemocrat.com or 803-533-5545. Follow on Twitter: @MRBrownTandD.
