title: Next Man Utd manager latest with Pochettino favourite to replace Ten Hag despite FA Cup win
creator: Craig Mahood
content: MAURICIO POCHETTINO remains the favourite to be the next Manchester United manager. The former Spurs and Chelsea manager - who left his role at Stamford Bridge last week -leads the race to take over from Erik ten Hag . But after United finished the season with somewhat of a flourish, are they in the market for a new manager this summer? That's the question for Sir Jim Ratcliffe and co, who witnessed the FA Cup win at Wembley and saw the respect Ten Hag had from the players and supporters after beating Manchester City. Wins over Newcastle and Brighton preceded it too. So is binning the Dutchman the right thing to do? Paddy Power make it 6/4 that he remains at Old Trafford next season and as low as 4/9 that he's replaced. So with it more likely he'll be gone, we look at the top candidates seemingly strongly in contention with the bookmakers. It's always appeared destined that Pochettino would be in charge at Old Trafford one day. The unfortunate thing for him and the club, it's just never appeared to be the right time. He was a strong, strong favourite prior to Ten Hag's appointment and he's always been into a project when the opportunity has arisen. Reports suggest INEOS hold him in 'high esteem' having tried to land him for Nice a couple of years ago which never materialised. Odds continue to plummet. Stellar time at Brighton but is on the move this summer. Disappointing domestic campaign as they struggle to balance the league and European football but style of football a huge plus. Had been linked with Chelsea and Bayern but they both look to be heading in different directions. So that doesn't leave too many more options at the top end. Played United in final game of the season at the Amex as Brighton boss. Was the 2-0 defeat a good audition? Tuchel had attracted most of the money in recent weeks following the news he'd be quitting Bayern in the summer. He lost out comfortably in the Bundesliga race - finishing a disappointing third in the end - and guided them to the semi finals of the Champions League . Has Premier League experience having coached Chelsea , guiding them to European glory too. He won 63 of his 100 games in charge of the club. Also played United twice earlier in the season, winning both home and away in Champions League group stage fixtures. Odds on the drift and now third favourite after being a short price at the start of the month. The Ipswich boss was seemingly well in contention for both the Chelsea and Brighton roles, though that has changed over the weekend. Odds shortened all week in this market and a return to United looked to be on the cards at one stage. His style of play at Ipswich was one thing but back-to-back promotions from League One to the Premier League has shown he's a winner and puts him in the shop window for a host of top clubs. Will that past work at United help or hinder his chances? Who knows. Odds on the drift. Southgate's name was thrown into the mix earlier on this year and he's remained strong in the betting markets since. The England boss was reportedly the number one choice of Sir Jim Ratcliffe during his takeover process, with new technical director Jason Wilcox also a fan. Southgate's potential appointment is said to be universally welcome by those in the club, including the United players. His contract with the FA runs out in December of this year, meaning this summer's Euros could be his last in charge - after shelving talks on his future until after the tournament. Regardless of the outcome, he could look to leave on a high should England finally get over the line, or admit defeat and hand the reins to someone else should they disappoint on the continental stage yet again. Either way, he could be looking for a fresh challenge after the summer and Old Trafford could present itself nicely. He's also worked with incoming sporting director Dan Ashworth at the FA, which also sways things in his favour. Paddy Power prices Earlier on this calendar year after a sticky spell for Ten Hag, it was GRAHAM POTTER (14/1) who dominated this particular market in the early parts of the season. Potter, who also has previous of working with Dan Ashworth at Brighton, has remained out of work since his sacking from Chelsea at the beginning of last year though has been linked with several top flight roles. Has met owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe and no surprises should his odds be shortened still, though is reportedly being lined up for Brighton return. THOMAS FRANK (14/1) saw considerable support last week but his odds have drifted slightly following the events of the last week. The Dane revealed he was really happy at Brentford just a few days ago but could the lure of United take him away if they came calling? title: Blood cancer day: More people urged to sign-up as stem cell donors, given the shortage
description: Thousands of patients are in dire need of matching stem cell donors to undergo life-saving transplants
content: By Our Bureau Comments READ LATER With only 0.09 per cent of the population registered as stem cell donors, there is a need for more people to join the stem cell registry, says DKMS BMST Foundation India, pointing to the severe shortage of donors. Patrick Paul, Chief Executive with the Foundation said, âIn India, someone is diagnosed with blood cancer or a severe blood disorder every five minutes. Despite the global registry having over 41 million donors, India has only about 0.6 million registered. Thousands of patients are in dire need of matching stem cell donors to undergo life-saving transplants. We need to expand our donor database significantly, to provide these patients a fighting chance.â His words come against the backdrop of World Blood Cancer Day (May 28). DKMS-BMST is a joint venture of two non-profit organisations, BMST (Bangalore Medical Services Trust) and DKMS, one of the largest international blood stem cell donor centres in the world, a note from the Foundation said. The representatives urged healthy people between 18 â 55 years to register and volunteer to become a stem cell donor. Over a lakh people from India are diagnosed annually with blood cancer and disorders such as thalassemia and aplastic anemia, a note from the Foundation said. âFor many of these patients, a blood stem cell transplant is their only hope for survival. While conventional methods like chemotherapy and radiation therapy are available, a blood stem cell transplant is often crucial for patients who are at high risk of relapse or who do not respond well to conventional treatments,â it added. Dr Nitin Agarwal, Head of Donor Request Management at the Foundation, pointed out that many people in India are unaware of what blood stem cell donation involves or have incorrect beliefs about the process. âItâs crucial to understand that matching for stem cell transplants, is based on Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA) characteristics, not just blood type. Education is key to dispelling these misconceptions and encouraging more people to register,â he said. Comments

content: Loading... Loading... Thousands of protesters are gathering in Taipei as opposition lawmakers attempt to pass controversial legislation that could curb President Lai Ching-teâs authority. What Happened : Thousands of demonstrators assembled in Taipei on Tuesday, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. The protests erupted as opposition lawmakers from the Kuomintang (KMT) and its allies in the Taiwan People's Party (TPP) sought to pass a contentious bill. The legislation would grant them greater investigative powers, potentially undermining President Lai Ching-te . Violent shoving matches broke out inside the legislature, echoing the unrest outside. Protesters expressed fears that the new powers could derail President Lai's agenda and lead to leaks of sensitive information. The proposed changes would allow lawmakers to summon the president, companies, and the public for questioning, and access confidential documents. Last weekâs protests were among the largest since the 2014 Sunflower Movement, which saw demonstrators occupy parliament to block an unpopular trade pact with China. Inside the legislature, Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) lawmakers opposed the amendments, covering the chamber with placards and shouting slogans. See Also: Hereâs What To Expect If Donald Trump Is Convicted As Jury Deliberations Begin Next Week The KMT, advocating closer ties with China, denies any external influence on the law. KMT lawmaker Ko Chih-en stated the reform reflects public opinion. President Lai, who was sworn in on May 20, faces potential challenges in implementing policies amid the legislative turmoil. Why It Matters : The protests come shortly after President Lai was inaugurated as Taiwanâs new president on May 20. Laiâs presidency marks a significant period for Taiwan. The legislative push by the KMT and TPP is seen as an attempt to limit Laiâs influence early in his term. Adding to the tension, a senior U.S. lawmaker recently confirmed that Taiwanâs ordered weapons are on their way , amid escalating military tensions with China. This development underscores the geopolitical stakes involved in Taiwanâs internal politics and its relationship with major global powers. Read Next: Biden Vs. title: Rafael Nadal might skip Wimbledon in a bid to be match-fit for 2024 Paris Olympics
creator: Vineela Sekhar
description: Rafael Nadal was ousted from the French Open in the first round by fourth seed Alexander Zverev
content: Rafael Nadal might skip Wimbledon in a bid to be match-fit for 2024 Paris Olympics Rafael Nadal might miss Wimbledon, the grass court Grand Slam, in order to be match ready for the upcoming 2024 Paris Olympics. The Spaniard, after his first-round exit at the ongoing 2024 French Open, opined it would not be âsmartâ for him to compete in a Grand Slam right before the Olympics. Nadal was ousted from the French Open in the first round by fourth seed Alexander Zverev. This was the first time Nadal has exited the French Open, a tournament he has won a record 14 times, in the first round. Zverev won 6-3 ,7-6(5), 6-3. Zverev became the third player in the history of the sport to beat Nadal at Roland Garros, behind Novak Djokovic and Robin Soderling. The 37-year-old southpaw opined that playing a Grand Slam (Wimbledon in this case) and the Olympics in quick succession wouldnât be smart on his part, especially given he has been struggling to cope up with injuries. âI canât confirm anything, but I donât think itâs smart after everything my body has been through,â he said. Nadal explained the reason behind thinking of skipping Wimbledon. âIt will be difficult playing on grass, considering that right after Wimbledon are the Olympic Games,â he said. Nadal won Wimbledon twiceâin 2008 and 2010âbut also endured some of his toughest moments at the All England Club. He last played in the tournament in 2022, when he was forced to withdraw before his semifinal against Nick Kyrgios with an abdomen strain.

title: Top UK Scientist Warns Another Pandemic Is âAbsolutely Inevitableâ
creator: Northlines
description: The Covid-19 pandemic raged between 2019 to 2021, following which small waves of the virus were witnessed across the world. As the world is just getting over Covid-19 after four years, a top British scientist warned that another pandemic is âabsolutely inevitableâ. The former chief scientific adviser to the British government, Sir Patrick Vallance, urged [...]The post Top UK Scientist Warns Another Pandemic Is âAbsolutely Inevitableâ appeared first on Northlines.
content: The Covid-19 pandemic raged between 2019 to 2021, following which small waves of the virus were witnessed across the . As the world is just getting over Covid-19 after four years, a top British scientist warned that another pandemic is âabsolutely inevitableâ. The former chief scientific adviser to the British government, Sir Patrick Vallance, urged the UK government to prioritise preparations for the pandemic and emphasized that the country is ânot readyâ for it yet, reported. According to the report, Vallance, speaking at a panel event at the Hay Festival in Powys, stressed that the UK government must implement âbetter surveillanceâ to detect the threats of the virus. He also recommended some measures to prevent drastic steps during the Covid-19 pandemic, such as diagnostic tests, vaccines, and treatments. The top scientist believes that such measures could be implemented, however, it would require some coordination. âWe know we have to have an army, not because there's going to be a war this year, but we know it's an important part of what we need as a nation. We need to treat this preparedness in the same way and not to view it as an easy thing to keep cutting back when there's no sign of a pandemic â because there won't be a sign of a pandemic,â he said, as quoted by The Guardian. According to the report, Vallance also said that by 2023, G7 had âsort of forgottenâ his points about the pandemic preparations in 2021. âYou can't forget about it,â he said. The British scientist, during the panel event, mentioned the World Organization's (WHO) pandemic accord, calling it a âpositive stepâ. However, he also criticised its âlack of focus and urgencyâ. Last week, the WHO said that Covid-19 has cut global life expectancy by almost two years, wiping out a decade of progress. According to the UN health agency's world health statistics study, global life expectancy fell 1.8 years to 71.4 years â the same level it was in 2012. The study said that the amount of time an average person can expect to live in good health fell 1.5 years to 61.9 years in 2021. The Covid-19 pandemic raged between 2019 to 2021, following which small waves of the virus were witnessed across the world.

title: NASS Holds Joint Sitting For 25 Years Of Democracy Tomorrow
creator: James Kwen
description: The Senate and the House of Representatives will tomorrow hold a joint sitting to mark the 25 years of unbroken democracy/legislature in Nigeria. The joint sitting to commemorate Nigeriaâs democracy will be the first of its kind by the National Assembly since the inception of the Fourth Republic in 1999. The two chambers only sit [...]
content: The Senate and the House of Representatives will tomorrow hold a joint sitting to mark the 25 years of unbroken democracy/legislature in Nigeria. The joint sitting to commemorate Nigeriaâs democracy will be the first of its kind by the National Assembly since the inception of the Fourth Republic in 1999. The two chambers only sit jointly during the budget presentation by the President, however, Wednesdayâs sitting will be historic in the countryâs democracy. A statement last night by the National Assembly management said President Bola Ahmed Tinubu is expected to deliver an address at the joint sitting. The president is also expected to commission the new National Assembly Library as part of the events slated for the 25 years celebration. Vice President Kashim Shettima will also attend the joint session. Also expected at the Joint sitting are the chairman of the Nigeria Governorsâ Forum (NGF) and governor of Kwara State, Alhaji Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, the chairman of the Progressives Governorsâ Forum, who is also the governor of Imo State, Hope Uzodinma, the secretary to the government of the federation (SGF), Senator George Akume and the chief of staff to the president, Hon. Femi Gbajabiamila. Others are the minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Barr. Nyesom Wike, the clerk to the National Assembly, Alhaji Magaji Tambuwal, the senior special assistants to the president for both the Senate and the House, among others. There will be commemorative lectures on 25 Years of the National Assembly: Lessons and Opportunities at the joint sitting. While Gbajabiamila, who served as the speaker of the 9th House (2019-2023) will deliver a paper on âReflections on the Houseâ, Senator David Mark, the president of the 6th and 7th Senate (2007-2015), will speak on âReflections on the Senateâ. Former head of state, General Abdulsalami Abubakar, will also deliver a paper on âReflections on the Journey to Democracy.â

title: Nokia set to win deal to supply 5G radio equipment to Portugal's MEO - report
content: Michael Vi Nokia ( NYSE: NOK ) is set to secure a deal to supply 5G radio equipment to Portugal-based telecom operator MEO, Reuters reported, citing an internal company blog post and two people with knowledge of the matter. Nokia is geared up to secure the contract despite China's Huawei Technologies having being MEO's only supplier of 2G, 3G and 4G Radio Access Network, or RAN, equipment, the report added . The agreement has received a greenlight but has not yet been signed, and an announcement could be made as early as next month, as per the report. MEO, which was formerly known as Telecom Portugal and now a unit of France's Altice, is one of Portugal's leading mobile operators. "In recent years, MEO ... has been supplied in RAN only by Huawei. In other words, Huawei has had a 100% market share in 2G/3G/4G. We have now been selected to replace Huawei in some of the key markets in Portugal," wrote Tommi Uitto, president of Nokia's mobile networks, in the internal company memo. The agreement would mark Nokia's return to Portugal's RAN market after it lost market share to Chinese tech giant Huawei several years ago and has not supplied any communications service providers with RAN in the nation since then, Uitto noted in the blog. RAN tools have generated the majority of telecom sales for companies such as Huawei, Nokia and Sweden-based Ericsson ( ERIC ) ( OTCPK:ERIXF ), however a decline in demand for new tools from telcos since last year has impacted Nokia and Ericsson, pushing them to cut thousands of jobs. Meanwhile, Huawei â which was banned in the U.S. and certain European countries over security concerns â still has some presence in the EU and is a major player in the telecom market in China. title: Thousands of bees killed in vandalism attack on Tayside farm
description: Police in the Tayside area are appealing for information after a farm in Inchyra was vandalised leaving 2,000 bees dead.
content: The owners of a Tayside farm have expressed their âutter contemptâ for the people who vandalised their property over the weekend, leaving 2000 bees dead. Police in the area are appealing for information after parts of Tofthill Farm in Inchyra were damaged in a vandalism incident. Officers say the damage must have taken place between 5pm on Friday 24 May, and 10 am on Saturday 25 May. Those responsible for the overnight attack have yet to be traced, after the damage left 2,000 bees dead and multiple fresh strawberry plants ruined. The owners of the farm have released a statement saying how disappointed they are with the attack on their property, especially after an âincredibly difficult winterâ and during a time when food production in Scotland is becoming harder every year. READ MORE: ScotGov plan to 'eradicate' hornet threatening Honeybees Scottish Bee Company honey praised by Nigella Lawson A spokesperson for the farm said: âWe are incredibly disappointed to be subjected to a vandalism at the weekend. Aside from jumping on our equipment and damaging it, the most heart-breaking aspect of it is that some 2,000 bees were killed and dozens of fresh strawberry plants were maliciously damaged. âBees are truly the most magnificent and efficient pollinators on any farm and itâs thanks to them that we all get fed. âAfter an incredibly difficult winter for farming, where it is getting harder and harder to produce food, we only have utter contempt for the individuals who have caused thousands of pounds worth of damageâ. Anyone with any information is asked to contact Police on 101 quoting incident 1838 of 25/05/24 and crime ref CR/0190102/24

title: List of MPs standing down at General Election
description: Conservative MPs account for the majority of members not seeking re-election.
content: It includes 77 Conservative MPs, which is the highest number in modern political history, surpassing the previous post-war record of 72 Tories who stood down ahead of the 1997 election. The record for the total number of MPs standing down at an election is 149, which was set in 2010. The list has been compiled by the PA news agency. MPs are listed alphabetically by party and all majorities are for the 2019 general election. â Conservative (77) â Adam Afriyie, Windsor (MP since 2005; majority 20,079) â Nickie Aiken, Cities of London & Westminster (MP since 2019; title: List of MPs standing down at General Election
description: Conservative MPs account for the majority of members not seeking re-election.
content: It includes 77 Conservative MPs, which is the highest number in modern political history, surpassing the previous post-war record of 72 Tories who stood down ahead of the 1997 election. The record for the total number of MPs standing down at an election is 149, which was set in 2010. The list has been compiled by the PA news agency. title: UBS downgrades Asahi Intecc stock, cites slow U.S. market entry
creator: Investing.com
content: On Tuesday, UBS has downgraded stock of Asahi Intecc Co Ltd (7747:JP) (OTC: AHICF) from Buy to Neutral, significantly lowering the price target to Â¥2,220 from the previous Â¥3,660. The revision reflects concerns over the anticipated slow progress in new U.S. market fields and the unlikely improvement in valuation multiples due to substantial quarterly sales volatility in China. According to UBS, the slower-than-expected ramp-up of Asahi Intecc's new fields in the U.S. is due to the prevalence of bundled marketing strategies by leading companies, which may hinder Asahi's market share growth. Consequently, the firm has adjusted its forecast for the operating profit before goodwill amortisation for the fiscal year ending June 2026 to Â¥26.9 billion, down from Â¥30.9 billion. This figure falls below the IFIS consensus of Â¥29.5 billion. In addition to the challenges in the U.S., Asahi Intecc's performance in China is also causing concern. Sales in China have been highly inconsistent, primarily due to the reliance on distributor-based marketing. This erratic sales pattern has led to a lack of earnings visibility, which UBS believes negatively impacts the company's valuation multiple. To align with these projections, UBS has also revised the price-to-earnings ratio (PER) estimate for Asahi Intecc, reducing it from 46.6X to a more conservative 29.6X. This adjustment is a direct reflection of the anticipated difficulties in the U.S. and China markets, which are key factors behind the lowered price target for the company's shares. This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

title: News24 Business | Godongwana says he will stay on if asked
description: Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said he is prepared to stay in his current role after the election and urged the country to choose stability over âchaosâ by voting for the African National Congress.
content: Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said he is prepared to stay in his current role after the election and urged the country to choose stability over âchaosâ by voting for the African National Congress. âIf I am asked to serve I will serve,â he said Tuesday in an interview on Bloomberg Television with Jennifer Zabasajja. âWhat these elections are about â are about stability and chaos â and the ANC provides that stability.â South Africans vote on Wednesday, with Godongwanaâs ruling ANC facing its toughest election fight since taking power in 1994. Opinion polls show ANC support dipping below 50%, which would force it into a coalition with a smaller rival. But recent rand strength suggests investors see it doing well enough to form a government without hooking up with parties to its left, which could push the country in a more populist and less market-friendly direction. Godongwana voiced confidence that the party will get over the line. âThe ANC is working on the assumption that weâre going to have 50 plus one.â

title: News24 | 'Not a rescue mission, ... a recovery mission': Hope fades for Papua New Guinea landslide survivors
description: It is "very unlikely" more survivors of Papua New Guinea's deadly landslide will be found, a UN agency warned, as thousands at risk from further slips were ordered to evacuate.
content: It is "very unlikely" more survivors of Papua New Guinea's deadly landslide will be found, a UN agency warned on Tuesday, as thousands at risk from further slips were ordered to evacuate. Some 2 000 people are feared buried by a massive landslide that entombed a remote highland community in the early hours of 24 May. Since then, locals have been picking through a hellscape of metres-deep churned-up earth, uprooted trees and car-sized boulders in the search for loved ones - often using little more than their hands, shovels and digging sticks. But hopes are dimming that anyone is alive underneath the mountain of rubble. "It is not a rescue mission, it is a recovery mission," Unicef Papua New Guinea's Niels Kraaier told AFP. "It is very unlikely they will have survived." READ | 'We are racing against time': Fears of another slide as 670 bodies found in Papua New Guinea Full-scale rescue and relief efforts have been severely hampered by the remote location, the only road link being severed, heavy rainfall and nearby tribal violence. The Papua New Guinea Defence Forces have struggled to access the site with heavy earth-moving equipment. Early on Tuesday, Enga provincial administrator Sandis Tsaka warned the disaster could worsen further, as clumps of limestone, dirt and rock continue to shear off the side of Mount Mungalo. Tsaka told AFP authorities were now trying to coordinate the evacuation of almost 7 900 more people. He said: "Every hour you can hear rock breaking - it is like a bomb or gunshot and the rocks keep falling down." Aid officials said many residents were refusing to leave at-risk areas because they were holding out hope of finding loved ones. Satellite images show the enormous scale of the disaster. A vast smear of yellow and grey debris can be seen cutting through once verdant bushland and severing the region's only road. "This was an area heavily populated with homes, businesses, churches and schools, it has been completely wiped out. It is the surface of the moon - it is just rocks," said Tsaka. "People are digging with their hands and fingers," he said, expressing anguish at the under-resourced government's inability to meet the enormity of the disaster. "I am not equipped to deal with this tragedy," Tsaka admitted. Overwhelmed Papua New Guinea authorities held an online emergency meeting with United Nations agencies and international allies Tuesday, hoping to kickstart the relief effort. Papua New Guinea's national disaster centre has told the United Nations that the initial "landslide buried more than 2 000 people alive". According to a letter obtained by AFP, the slide also "caused major destruction to buildings, food gardens and caused major impact on the economic lifeline of the country". The scale of the catastrophe required "immediate and collaborative actions from all players", it added, including the army, and national and provincial responders. Australia has announced millions of dollars' worth of aid, including emergency relief supplies such as shelters, hygiene kits and support for women and children. China's President Xi Jinping and his US counterpart Joe Biden - more accustomed to scrapping for influence in the strategically located country - both offered assistance. More than 1 000 people have already been displaced by the catastrophe, aid agencies have estimated. UN Development Programme official Nicholas Booth said up to 30 000 people could have been cut off by the disaster across several villages. These communities had enough supplies for the coming weeks, but opening up that road remained essential, he said. "This landslide has blocked the road westward, so not only are there challenges in accessing the village itself, but it does mean the communities beyond that are also cut off." Locals said the landslip may have been triggered by recent heavy rains. Papua New Guinea has one of the wettest climates in the world, and research has found shifting rainfall patterns linked to climate change could exacerbate the risk of landslides. The estimated death toll has climbed significantly since the disaster struck, as officials reassess the size of the population. Many people fleeing tribal violence have moved into the area in the past few years. The area is located about 600km from Port Moresby.

title: Adigun, AGHAN Chairman Bags Aviation Personality of the year Award
creator: Olusegun Koiki
description: LAGOS â Mr. Olaniyi Adigun, the Chairman, Aviation Ground Handling Association of Nigeria (AGHAN), has been conferred with the 2023 Aviation Personality of the Year. The award was bestowed on Adigun at the 10th edition of the Nigeria Transport Lecture, organised by Nigeria Transport Award, publishers of the Transport Day, held on Thursday at Raddison [...]
content: LAGOS â Mr. Olaniyi Adigun, the Chairman, Aviation Ground Handling Association of Nigeria (AGHAN), has been conferred with the 2023 Aviation Personality of the Year award. The award was bestowed on Adigun at the 10th edition of the Nigeria Transport Lecture, organised by Nigeria Transport Award, publishers of the Transport Day, held on Thursday at Raddison Blu Hotel, Government Reserved Area (G.R.A), Ikeja, Lagos. The glamorous ceremony convened by Mr. Frank Kintum, the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Transport Day, is an annual event where eminent personalities who have distinguished themselves in professional excellence and service to humanity in the private and public sectors are honoured. According to Kintum, Adigun was conferred with the special award in recognition of his huge contribution to the development of the aviation industry, especially the ground handling sub-sector where he has made a huge milestone in over three decades. Kintum explained that Adigun was selected for the award by the board and management of Transport Day after emerging tops in the polls conducted by the team. He specifically said that since Adigun was appointed the Chairman of AGHAN, he had been able to reposition the ground handling companies in the sector and worked endlessly to ensure a review of the former handling rates, which had been in existence in the last three decades. He said: âMr. Olaniyi Adigun, the President of AGHAN was nominated for this honour after a rigorous exercise, which focused on his activities and achievements in the Nigerian aviation industry, spanning over three decades. Adigun through his works, has consistently promoted safety, which is the hallmark of the global aviation industry. âWe want to use this medium to call on Adigun to continue to do more for the growth and development of the Nigerian aviation industry. To whom much is given, much more is expected from him.â In his speech, Adigun thanked the organisers of the event for finding him worthy to be selected for the honour. He also expressed delight at the achievements of AGHAN, but maintained that the association and the successes recorded were not about him, but its entire members. He added that the award had thrown AGHAN up for more good work. He said: âI feel very elated, appreciated and privileged to be awarded as the Aviation Personality of the Year 2023 after a long effort that we put into the sector, especially in the ground handling sector of the industry. âIt is unfortunate that the ground handling sub-sector of the aviation industry has not been given fair deal and attention by the government and its agencies, but some organisations in the sector have realised the enormous work that we do and awarded me the honour. âLike I do say, the government and its agencies are always losing money because of unfair competition in the handling sub-sector of the industry, especially between the two major ground handling companies. AGHAN as a body, has been trying to bring the major competitors together for the enhanced Nigerian economy and we pray this will work out very soon and for the betterment of the industry and the country at large.â He regretted that the airlines were taking full advantage of the unhealthy competition between the two major ground handling companies, but said since AGHAN came onboard a few years ago, such unwholesome practice had reduced to the barest minimum. Adigun came into the aviation industry in 1993 as a staff of the defunct national carrier, Nigeria Airways. At the Skyway Aviation Handling Company (SAHCO), he rose through the ranks to become its Executive Director, Sales & Marketing from 2018- 2024. During his stay, the department was able to implement various sales and marketing strategies that increased the companyâs revenue significantly, while its number of clienteles increased tremendously. Adigun was also appointed the pioneer Chairman of AGHAN in 2021.

title: Joaquin Domagoso on being a young dad: ''Yung purpose ko sa buhay, nabuo'
description: It has been almost two years since Joaquin Domagoso became a father to his son, Scott.
content: It has been almost two years since Joaquin Domagoso became a father to his son, Scott. In his interview on Tuesday's "Fast Talk with Boy Abunda," the Sparkle star shared that the little boy has started schooling. "I'm happy where my son is. He started school officially, so congrats to little Scott. Every day, new memories are being made," Joaquin said. The young actor said that he stands by the decisions he made. "My career won't stop itself because of my decisions because my will is as strong as my love for my son," he said. When asked what he discovered about himself as he goes through fatherhood, Joaquin said, "That I can work harder than I think I can't. There are things na before, I feel like, 'Hindi, kaya ko 'yon, pabayaan na, 'wag na.'" Now that he is already a dad, Joaquin said that he has also become a role model. "Kumbaga if I don't do these things, my son won'tâ'di niya ako susundan," he said. "And there are other things na, kumbaga, work. Working a 9-5 job, realizing it how other people would go through it. 'Yung tipong you wake up for your son, you do all these things. Tapos 'yung at the end of the day, uuwi ka, hinihintay ka pa rin. All the joys. 'Yung purpose ko sa buhay, nabuo." Joaquin did not share much about his current relationship status. "Sa aking love life ngayon po, I don't want to say anything too much, but right now, I'm in a very happy place," he said. Joaquin's dad, Isko Moreno , first revealed in July 2022 that Joaquin had welcomed a baby boy with Raffa Castro . In a previous interview on the show, Joaquin admitted that he felt scared of becoming a father , but his father was supportive about it. "He was dancing. Sumasayaw si Papa," he said. "Nawala 'yung stress ko 'cause I was so scared to tell them like what is my dad gonna say? Baka magalit. Magagalit sila." Joaquin currently appears in GMA Afternoon Prime series " Lilet Matias: Attorney-at-Law ," which airs weekdays at 3:20 p.m. after "Abot-Kamay Na Pangarap."

title: The Future Of Finance: AI And Blockchain Bridging Traditional Investment For A Better Tomorrow
creator: Ethan Lee | Prime Star
description: In the world of finance where new changes are occurring at a very fast pace, investments through conventional finance and the incorporation of technology like artificial intelligence are not just a trend but a revolution. This fusion is empowering the investment ecosystem for transparency, open access, and future-readiness bringing financial opportunities closer to everyone. At [...]The post The Future Of Finance: AI And Blockchain Bridging Traditional Investment For A Better Tomorrow appeared first on TechBullion.
content: Share Tweet Share Share Email In the world of finance where new changes are occurring at a very fast pace, investments through conventional finance and the incorporation of technology like artificial intelligence are not just a trend but a revolution. This fusion is empowering the investment ecosystem for transparency, open access, and future-readiness bringing financial opportunities closer to everyone. At the center of this process, there are two key areas â artificial intelligence and blockchain, which are actively getting involved in the recreation of peopleâs vision of investments. Big data, through the use of artificial intelligence and other predictive analytical tools, is enhancing the opportunities for making sound investment decisions while blockchain is the godsend for truly secure financial transactions. In parallel, the mentioned technologies are providing the foundation for new trends like tokenized assets, decentralized finance (DeFi), and relatively a new approach â DeFi or Regenerative Finance, based on the investment in social and environmental initiatives. Thus, Tokenized assets with the help of blockchain technology, it is a step forward. In essence, through the tokenization of physical assets using blockchain, investors can own a fraction of the asset because the technology subdivides the ownership rights to the underlying asset into smaller portions. This democratization of assets applies to various fields of the economy and have started with real estate assets, artworks, and even unique rarities. Furthermore, AI occupies a crucial place in this environment because it offers the instruments for the precise analysis of the great amount of information and anticipating market behaviors. For instance, using AI algorithms is possible to detect attractive investmentsâ options in real-time and thus maximize investment outcomes. We observe this symbiotic relationship between AI and blockchain in such areas such as digital coins and tokens that have become fashionable. These digital assets usually have initial and/or subsequent rewards where more or new coin holders are bestowed with free tokens making the cryptocurrency investment more attractive and easily accessible. This though creates the potential of making huge profits through these unique financial entities. _algoic trading strategies are capable of making trades in a very short time and exploiting gaps in the overall market that may not be apparent to a human trader. While the above mentioned transactions have a lot of possibility of being fraudulent or manipulated, with the use of blockchain, it maximizes the security and transparency as well. This high-performance, high-speed, highly effective system is a significant improvement and will be of tremendous help to experienced investors and newcomers alike. Moreover, establishing ReFi as the trend of investment with an aim is proving to be rather popular. As integrated AI and blockchain solutions, ReFi projects work to create positive social and environmental impacts alongside solutions for money. Such projects may involve climate change solutions like energy generation from natural sources, efficient farming, and social justice products, which give individuals an opportunity to invest in the future and generate profits. Another work in progress key feature of the evolution of the investment landscape is decentralized finance (DeFi) platform. These platforms utilize blockchain technology to dispose of the middlemen and cut the costs but at the same time improved efficacy. DeFi puts people in the position of providing and requesting funds, goods, or services, with others and often presents artificial intelligence solutions to perform the necessary operations. Due to this transparency, all transactions made and captured in the block chain are traceable by the public thereby minimizing on cases of disputations and increasing trust among the players involved. Furthermore, the usage of airdrop has evolved as a vital strategy for attracting the community and involving the users in the DeFi ecosystem. It explains how through providing a variety of tokens users with free tokens DeFi projects can gain popularity very quickly and encourage people to engage in activities within their platforms. Integrating AI into Defi platforms enhances some of the functionality of DeFi platforms in the following ways. AI can be applied to identify usersâ behavior and patterns, market trends and fluctuations, and provide recommendations on which investments should be made, how they should be distributed, and which direction the market is likely to take nex so you can make moneyt. Such level of customization and idea of future in financial aspect was beyond the boldest scenario in traditional finance. Furthermore, it is capable of analyzing unstructured data hence can include social feeds, oil price changes, Acts of God, tweets erratically, and any other issues that relate to investment. They integrate this approach to make sure that AI driven investments not only yield higher returns but are also immune to instabilities in the market conditions. To conclude, the integration of the traditional financial industry with top-notch technological solutions such as the use of AI and blockchain technologies is making the investment environment more comprehensive and effective. The decentralization of possibilities and the mitigation of risks, through using Artificial Intelligence in trading, and by means of tokenization, the advent of DeFi, ReFi â these trends are contributing towards a more open and explicable approach to investments. As to the possibilities of earning money through these new financial tools, the prospect can be very high, and it opens a new vista to all those involved in the financial market whether a new player or an experienced investor. It can, therefore, be concluded that as we advance in the future, the promotion and application of such advanced technologies are bound to come up with more groundbreaking specialty investment and consequently yield a positive future for a worthy better future for generations. title: El Salvador is now Hub for Diverse Business Operations
creator: Paul Ugbede Godwin
description: El Salvador, the smallest and most densely populated country in Central America, is experiencing a significant economic transformation. With over 80 companies establishing their operations in the nation, itâs becoming a hub for diverse business activities. This surge in corporate presence is a testament to the countryâs strategic efforts to diversify its economy and create [...]The post El Salvador is now Hub for Diverse Business Operations appeared first on Tekedia.
content: El Salvador, the smallest and most densely populated country in Central America, is experiencing a significant economic transformation. With over 80 companies establishing their operations in the nation, itâs becoming a hub for diverse business activities. This surge in corporate presence is a testament to the countryâs strategic efforts to diversify its economy and create a more conducive environment for business growth. Historically, El Salvadorâs economy was heavily reliant on agriculture, with coffee exports being the primary source of revenue. However, the turn of the century marked a pivotal shift as the country adopted the U.S. dollar as its official currency, paving the way for increased trade and financial links. This move, coupled with the expansion of the manufacturing sector, has reduced the nationâs dependence on coffee and positioned it as an attractive destination for international businesses. The list of companies operating in El Salvador is diverse, ranging from financial institutions like the Central Reserve Bank of El Salvador to telecommunications giants such as Claro El Salvador and Tigo El Salvador. The country also boasts a vibrant media landscape with entities like El Faro and La Prensa GraÌfica, reflecting a robust mass media sector. Join Tekedia Capital Syndicate and i nvest in Africaâs finest startups here . In recent years, El Salvador has seen a rise in startups and innovative companies, further enriching its economic landscape. Companies like Cubo, which supports small businesses with digital payments, and intmax, a developer of blockchain platforms, are prime examples of the new wave of tech-driven enterprises flourishing in the country. These startups not only contribute to the economy but also bring fresh ideas and technologies to the forefront. The retail sector in El Salvador is not left behind, with companies like SIMAN and Supermercados Super Selectos providing a wide range of consumer goods. The Unicomer Group, a retailer of durable goods and electronics, signifies the growth potential in the consumer services industry. El Salvadorâs commitment to nurturing a business-friendly environment is evident in its support for these companies. The governmentâs initiatives to streamline business operations, enhance legal frameworks, and invest in infrastructure have played a crucial role in attracting and retaining businesses. The influx of companies in El Salvador is a positive indicator of the countryâs economic health and its potential for future growth. Itâs a narrative of resilience and strategic adaptation, showcasing how a nation can pivot from traditional economic models to embrace globalization and technological advancements. Moreover, El Salvadorâs adoption of the U.S. dollar as its official currency has streamlined financial transactions and bolstered investor confidence. This economic stability, coupled with the governmentâs efforts to diversify the economy, has made the country an attractive destination for foreign investment. The presence of these companies signifies a positive shift in El Salvadorâs economic landscape, promising a future of prosperity and opportunity. As El Salvador continues to welcome businesses from around the globe, it stands as a testament to the resilience and entrepreneurial spirit of its people. As El Salvador continues to welcome businesses from various sectors, it stands as a beacon of economic opportunity in Central America. The countryâs journey is a compelling story of transformation, one that other nations looking to revitalize their economies can learn from. El Salvadorâs progress serves as a reminder that with the right policies and a focus on innovation, even the smallest countries can make a significant impact on the global economic stage.

title: Deadly landslide threatens thousands more in PNG as hopes for survivors fade
description: PORT MORESBY â Papua New Guinea authorities say nearly 7,900 people living near the site of a deadly landslide are "at risk" as rock and debris continue to move down the hillside.An alert for
content: PORT MORESBY â Papua New Guinea authorities say nearly 7,900 people living near the site of a deadly landslide are "at risk" as rock and debris continue to move down the hillside. An alert for potential evacuation has been put out, with a province official saying the mountain remains "very active". Rescuers say it is increasingly unlikely that victims will be found alive in the rubble. The country's disaster agency says it fears about 2,000 people were buried when a mountainside collapsed last Friday. This is much higher than the UN's estimate of about 670 victims. The UN says it has been difficult to establish an exact death toll as access to the site and those buried under the mass remain difficult. Part of that is due to complications around the search and recovery mission, which has now largely turned into a retrieval operation of bodies, various UN officials have said. "It is not a rescue mission, it is a recovery mission," Niels Kraaier from Unicef Papua New Guinea told news agency AFP. "It is very unlikely they will have survived." Only six bodies had been recovered as of Tuesday, according to local officials. Villagers have been using using shovels, sticks and their bare hands to try and remove huge rocks and rubble amid hold-ups in the arrival of heavy machinery, and also cultural sensitivities around the use of such machines like excavators near bodies. Standing in a crowd of mourners on Monday, local resident Jiman Yandam said people would keep digging manually to try and recover victims. "We don't know where the bodies are buried, but we will not give up, we will keep going," the former community leader told Reuters news agency. One woman, standing in the wreckage, described feeling helpless. "I have 18 of my family members buried under the debris and soil that I am standing on, and a lot more family members in the village I cannot count," Evit Kambu said. "But I cannot retrieve the bodies so I am standing here helplessly." The terrain remains dangerous as rocks continue to fall. Videos taken during the day have shown rocks tumbling down the mountain. âItâs still very active. The mountain is breaking up, " Sandis Tsaka, Enga Provincial Administrator told the BBC. "Thereâs continuous movement of rock and debris which is making our search and rescue and recovery operations a challenge," he added. The rubble remains 10m deep in some places and the mass of debris is still moving down the hillside, prompting authorities to alert nearby communities to the risk and issuing evacuation notices. "Because of the landslide, the impact area of the landslide is gradually increasing. So the homes and properties that were not affected by the original landslide area are growing every day," Mr Tsaka said. Another village close to the first-hit Yambali village was now also in danger, he said. There is also growing alarm over the risk of infection and disease in the area as the mass of bodies trapped under the rubble begin to decay. The UN had warned that currents were flowing down the hillside under the rubble. "The water that is stuck between the ground and the debris is flowing - and the bodies are starting to decay. Can you image [the impact] on more than 2,000 bodies buried under this land- unable to be removed," UN migration agency official Serhan Aktoprak told the BBC on Tuesday. Amid the treacherous conditions, aid groups say they are focusing on the immediate task of getting basic supplies like food, water and hygiene kits to residents. But there have been several barriers- including the highway to the village being blocked and damaged by the landslide. âOn Tuesday, it was reported that a bridge south of the landslide area, connecting province centers Hagen and Wabeg, had also collapsed making it more difficult for humanitarian groups delivering relief. Australia has pledged an airlift of supplies which is expected to arrive on Wednesday. Local officials say about 3,800 people had been living in the hillside village prior to the landslide, which took place around 03:00 on Friday morning and flattened more than 150 homes. The mountain's collapse has been attributed to weeks of heavy rain and other wet conditions in the area. Prime Minister James Marape had earlier in the week sent his condolences and directed national response teams to the region. The disaster comes as Mr Marape faces political pressure - parliament was expected to vote on a no-confidence motion against him on Tuesday. â BBC < Previous Page Next Page >

title: Modenik Lifestyle ropes in former P&G India chief L. V Vaidyanathan as Executive Chairman
description: Vaidyanathan, an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad, began his career with P&G and has over 25 years of experience across multiple markets, including India, Vietnam, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia and Singapore
content: By Meenakshi Verma Ambwani Comments READ LATER Modenik Lifestyle, which is backed by Advent International, has announced the appointment of L.V. Vaidyanathan as its Executive Chairman effective July. Vaidyanathan, is former MD and CEO of P&G India. The company is known for essential wear brands such as Dixcy Scott and Enamor. Vaidyanathan will succeed Sunil Sethi who is retiring from the position of Executive Chairman on July 31. Sethi will continue to serve on the Board of Directors. âThese leadership changes mark a new chapter for Modenik Lifestyle, reinforcing the companyâs commitment to innovation, excellence, and sustainable growth. The board is confident that with these appointments, Modenik will continue to strengthen its market position and drive forward its strategic objectives,âan official statement added. Vaidyanathan, an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad, began his career with P&G and has over 25 years of experience across multiple markets, including India, Vietnam, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia and Singapore. âWe thank Sunil, whose leadership has built Modenik into a high quality organisation today, with robust systems and processes. We are excited for the next phase of Modenikâs journey, and we believe L.V. Vaidyanathanâs vast expertise and forward-thinking approach will elevate Modenik to a market leading position,â said Sahil Dalal, Managing Director at Advent India PE Advisors. â I am thrilled to join Modenik Lifestyle, a company celebrated for its innovation and leadership in the essential wear industry. Sunil Sethiâs outstanding contributions have established a robust foundation. I am eager to collaborate with Shekhar Tewari and Modenikâs talented team to drive growth and achieve new milestones,â added Vaidyanthan Shantanu Khosla, Board Member, Modenik Lifestyle said, âAs LV transitions from his successful tenure at P&G to join Modenik, it reflects a broader trend of multinational CEOs moving to private equity-backed companies in India, drawn by the opportunity to drive rapid growth and create substantial value. His decision to join us underscores his confidence in our vision and commitment to advancing our growth trajectory. Additionally, the elevation of Shekhar Tewari to CEO further strengthens our management team, and I am excited to see the innovations and successes that this new leadership will bring.â Comments

title: Governors laud mediation team for increasing funds to counties to Sh400bn
creator: IRENE MWANGI
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 28 â The Council of Governors have lauded Members of Parliament for reaching a consensus to allocate Sh400 billion to devolved units following protracted battles between the two houses on the shareable revenue allocation. The County Bosses expressed their gratitude to Senators for remaining adamant to push the shareable revenue to counties [...]
content: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 28 â The Council of Governors have lauded Members of Parliament for reaching a consensus to allocate Sh400 billion to devolved units following protracted battles between the two houses on the shareable revenue allocation. The County Bosses expressed their gratitude to Senators for remaining adamant to push the shareable revenue to counties upwards by Sh9 billion in the incoming financial year 2024/2025 which commences in June. âDevolution is sacrosanct in the constitution and adequately resourcing functions that counties are mandated to deliver is progressive and a welcome move,â COG chairperson Waiguru stated. The mediation team of the two houses reached a consensus following differing proposal as the Senate initially pushing to have Counties allocated Sh415 billion while the National Assembly wanted the counties allocated Sh391 billion. The stalemate on the matter was ironed out after the Senate and National Assembly reached an agreement over the allocation for shareable revenue in the financial year 2024/2025 following days taken in lengthy deliberations. National Assembly Budget Committee Chairman Ndindi Nyoro who co-chaired the talks exuded confidence that progress had been made. âThe Senate has agreed to reduce their figure by Sh15 billion while the National Assembly has agreed to push up its earlier figure by Sh9 billion in the spirit of give and take so that we can resolve this matter and allow Counties to get their increased allocation from Sh385 billion in the last financial year,â Nyoro stated. Senate Deputy Speaker Kathuri Murungi who co-chaired committee called upon county bosses to ensure championing of development in their respective counties through prudent use of resources. âWe have held lengthy deliberations and we are all in agreement that devolution Iâd working and that it should be supported by ensuring that counties get sufficient funds to carry out the devolved functions,â Murungi said. Senate Speaker Amason Kingi and National Assembly Speaker Moses Wetangula appointed nine members each to join the mediation team so as to iron out the stalemate that would have affected the counties. Murungi and Kiharu MP Ndindi Nyoro were elected as the co- chairmen for the mediation committee. Wetangula appointed Kiharu MP Ndindi Nyoro, Teso South MP Mary Emase, Ugenya MP David Ochieng, Alego Usonga MP Samuel Atandi, Kapenguria MP Samuel Moroto,Kitutu Chache North MP Japheth Nyakundi,Samburu West MP Naisula Lesuuda, Kitui Central MP Makali Mulu, and Garsen MP Ali Wario to be members of this team. Kingi appointed Senate Deputy Speaker Kathuri Murungi, Homa Bay Senator Moses Kajwang, Kakamega Senator Boni Khalwale, Nairobi Senator Edwin Sifuna, Isiolo Senator Fatuma Dullo, Uasin Gishu Senator Jackson Mandago, Machakos Senator Kavindu Muthama, Marsabit Senator Mohammed Chute and Migori Senator Eddy Oketch to be members of the committee. title: EastEnders star slams house builder after being left with no flooring, wonky windows and dodgy cupboards in new home
creator: Joshua Rom
content: ONE of the stars from EastEnders has slammed his house builder after being left in an 'unsuitable home'. The soap actor posted a comedy video onto social media as he pranced about in his unfinished new home. Liam Hatch, 27, is one of the newest cast members of the long-running BBC soap. He recently joined the square as bad-boy Logan in a recent storyline where he bullied Amy Mitchell (Ellie Dadd). His group also beat up both Denzel Danes ( Jaden Ladega ) and Yolande Trueman ( Angela Wynter ) in horrific scenes. However, it seems the EastEnders actor and personal trainer had a huge drama of his own at his new home. He took to social media in an attempt to raise attention, after he failed to get adequate answers by the building company. Liam recently moved into a new-build home, but he claims he was left with no flooring and wonky windows. He also claimed that he cannot house his household appliances and that loose screws dug into his feet. The star posted a sarcastic dancing video to the track 'Faith' by George Michael from his abode. The unfinished flooring and lack of furniture was clearly seen as he jokingly praced around the kitchen and garden of the property. In the captions he wrote a long essay which read: "Bought a new house... ð¡ *CUT THE CELEBRATION* ð â. "We have floors unsuitable to lay on, we have screws digging into my feet, we have wonky windows and a cupboard not straight to fit my washing machine in, and to top it all off they ainât answering the emails....but...we have faith." "I have seen many negative comments with no reply... Iâm here to make sure peopleâs voices are heard. @taylorwimpey ð" After tagging the company, he finished the post with a string of sarcastic hashtags as he lamented the seemingly unfinished job. The Sun has approached Taylor Wimpey for comment. This comes after fans were recently shocked after they discovered Liam's real age and his racy Instagram account . Despite appearing as a teenager in a school uniform in the soap, making him no older than 16, Liam is in fact 27 in real life. When he isn't working as an actor, he has a side hustle as a personal trainer and online coach. Aside from this new video, the rest of his Instagram account is full of shirtless pictures of him working out at the gym. He's also partial to showing off his rear end as A number of pictures on his profile page show him posing outside, facing away from the camera totally naked.

title: Calvin Brooks: Defenders agrees to 10th season with Terras
description: WEYMOUTH have secured defender Calvin Brooks for the 2024/25 Vanarama National League South season.
content: Brooks will stay at Weymouth for a 10th campaign in claret and blue, meaning he could reach the 350-game landmark next term. The Weymouth vice-captain currently has 337 appearances, with 31 goals and 30 assists for the Terras. Brooks made just 25 appearances last season before a serious knee injury put paid to any involvement for the remainder of the campaign. He has undergone surgery after electing to continue playing and confirmed to Echosport last November that he would prefer to finish his career with Weymouth . In a club statement, Weymouth said: âWe are delighted to confirm the signature of Calvin Brooks to continue in claret and blue for the 24/25 season. âA man who needs little introduction to the Terrasâ faithful, Calvin has become a great part of the club and surrounding community. Originally made his debut back on 27th September 2014. âMarking this upcoming season as his 10th for the club. Impressively, only eight players have featured in more campaigns at the club since World War Two. âCalvin unfortunately missed a large part of the end of last season through injury and has since undergone surgery to aid his recovery. His return is anticipated closer than those may think. âWith 337 appearances currently under his belt, 31 goals and 30 assists, it gives a continuation of consistency to this ever-growing new-look Weymouth as we approach the new season.â Brooks is the 10th Weymouth player to commit for the 2024/25 season, with Ezio Touray, Brandon Goodship, Jordon Thompson, Leo Hamblin, Charlie Rowan, Gerard Benfield, captain Tom Bearwish, Keelan OâConnell and Josh McQuoid all pledging allegiance to the Terras.

title: Households saving hundreds of pounds a year by boosting home energy efficiency â how you can too
creator: Sam Walker
content: BRITISH households are saving hundreds of pounds each year by introducing efficient upgrades to their home. A poll of 2,000 adults responsible for paying the bills found 63% have invested in home energy efficiencies, with a quarter doing so in the last year. The average household estimates this has made an annual saving of Â£283.90. Motivations behind these upgrades have been reducing energy bills (49%), making their home more sustainable (36%), and adding value to their property (23%). The most popular home improvements that have been made include draught proofing, boiler upgrades, and insulation. And 3.3 million smart meters were installed in British homes in 2023. The study, commissioned by Smart Energy GB, found that in addition to making savings on their energy, the average bill payer believes they have increased their average house value by Â£2,934.60 by making certain improvements. Smart Energy GB has teamed up with property website, Rightmove, to reveal this data. It shows that improving a homeâs Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) rating from F to C could increase its value by up to 15% - which for the average home means an extra Â£55,848. Tim Bannister, Rightmoveâs property expert, said: âWe know upfront costs are the biggest barrier to people making green improvements in their home, especially when it can take time to see the return on investment and lower bills. âOur analysis shows that thereâs a green price premium on top of the local house price growth when people sell homes that theyâve been able to make green improvements to, and in the coming years a homeâs energy efficiency rating is likely to become an even bigger factor when choosing a home to buy or rent .â The study found exactly three quarters would consider the EPC rating of a property when looking to buy, compared to only 38% who wouldâve said the same a decade ago. It also emerged the average adult in charge of household bills would be willing to pay an additional Â£6,360 for a home equipped with sustainable features, according to the OnePoll.com data. While 26% think making home upgrades to improve energy efficiency are now more important than aesthetic ones. Victoria Bacon, director at Smart Energy GB, said: âSmart home investments can be very good for the bank balance in the long run, but not all upgrades have to be costly. âSmart meters are installed at no extra cost by your energy supplier and are a tool that more and more Brits are using to help them find ways to reduce their energy use day to day, which can have a noticeable positive impact on energy bills over time. âThey also open up access to reward schemes which offer money off energy bills for reducing energy use at certain times.â The research also revealed 36% have made eco upgrades to make their property more sustainable, and create energy efficient homes for younger generations (31%). ENERGY bills remain relatively high leaving many worrying over the thermostat. Energy experts have revealed the exact temperature to set it at so that you can save cash and still keep warm. When it comes to your thermostat, the Energy Saving Trust recommends you should set it to the "lowest comfortable temperature". For the majority of us, this is between 18 and 21 degrees Celsius. It's just the right balance between keeping your home warm, and keeping those energy bills as low as possible. If you have your thermostat set at a higher temperature you can probably afford to turn it down and still keep cosy. Of course, there are exceptions like anyone who is in ill health , and there is support available to cover extra costs . Just by turning down the temp by a single degree, you could save as much as Â£100 a year. If you cut it by more you will obviously make even bigger savings. The Energy Saving Trust also says that you donât need to turn your thermostat up when it is colder outside, the house will still heat up to the set temperature. While 62% claim they think more about how their energy usage around the home will impact the environment than they did 10 years ago. It also emerged 23% of those polled plan to make certain green changes to where they live this year. Steph McGovern, broadcaster and consumer finance expert, said: âI know first-hand how difficult it can be to decide the best way to future-proof a home and make smart investments. âBut with so many options out there, itâs reassuring to know that you donât have to spend a huge amount of money to add value to a property and save on energy bills.â Smart Energy GB has partnered with MoneyMagpie to share tips for people looking to make energy efficient upgrades to their home: Do you have a money problem that needs sorting? Get in touch by emailing money-sm@news.co.uk . Plus, you can join our Sun Money Chats and Tips Facebook group to share your tips and stories

title: Barry Keoghan is every inch the proud boyfriend as he supports Sabrina Carpenter at BBC Radio 1 Big Weekend's live gig

The Saltburn favourite, 31, was spotted enjoying the show from a private spot backstage at the festival in Luton's Stockwood Park. As Sabrina, 25, graced the stage performing her latest banger Espresso - Barry was pictured smiling, dancing and clapping along. Meanwhile the former Disney actress pulled out all the stops in a plunging orange mini dress as she performed alongside the likes of Coldplay and Olly Alexander The singer teamed the number with white knee-high socks and matching platform heels Sabrina appeared mesmerised by the crowd's warm welcome, and pointed out: 'This is actually my first time performing in Luton' The pop sensation looked in her element as she took to the stage with confidence, performing a slew of best hits including her latest banger Espresso The Pennsylvania-born superstar sent fans into frenzy with her vibrant performance - as she keeps making the most of her glory after her latest single Espresso topped charts as UK number one single, even outclassing Taylor Swift. Sabrina recently opened up about her 'fun' and 'messy' love life as she gave an insight into her romance with Barry. The singer and Dunkirk actor were first linked in September 2023, but made their red carpet debut at the Met Gala earlier this month. Sabrina has now said she 'really connects with people who are in touch with their emotions' as discussed her romance with Cosmopolitan magazine. When it comes to dating, Sabrina said: 'A lot of it, for me, has been fate. I know that's super broad, but I don't actively look for it. 'The relationships that I actually want to put my energy into have to be so interesting or invigorating because they take me away from the other things I love. So yeah, it's fun and it's messy.' The songstress revealed she is 'attracted' to someone who becomes her 'best friend' and can bring a lot of 'energy and humour' to a relationship. Discussing her type, Sabrina added: 'I'm super attracted to a lot of the things I look for in friends because I want to be with someone who's going to be one of my best friends. So a lot of it is energy and humour and being genuine. I will say I've always connected more with people who are really in touch with their emotions.' Sabrina was first linked to Barry last September but they didn't make their first public appearance together until the December. In February, the couple confirmed their romance as they posed at a Grammys afterparty together after posing separately next to each other on the red carpet. Earlier this month, Barry threw Sabrina a lavish 25th birthday party complete with an hilarious meme birthday cake of Leonardo DiCaprio. The singer enjoyed a party with 100 of her friends thrown by the Saltburn actor at DUMBO House in Brooklyn. Barry has also supported Sabrina at a number of her gigs including her first at Coachella music festival. Barry was previously in a relationship with Alyson Kierans, who he welcomed a son with called Brando in August 2022 . The pair are thought to have broken up over the summer of last year. When Barry was asked about the split in GQ early this year, he said only that Alyson had 'done a great job and sheâs an incredible mother.' Sabrina, meanwhile, saw her dating life become a hot topic during the summer of 2020, when she was rumoured to be in a love triangle with Joshua Bassett and his High School Musical: The Musical: The Series co-star Olivia Rodrigo . The following year, Olivia poured fuel on the fire by releasing her runaway smash hit single Driver's License, which was widely thought to be about Joshua and Sabrina. 'And you're probably with that blonde girl, who always made me doubt. She's so much older than me,' sang Olivia, who is nearly four years younger than Sabrina. In the interim, Sabrina has at various stages been linked to such names as pop act Shawn Mendes, Teen Wolf actor Dylan O'Brien and YouTuber David Dobrik. It comes after Sabrina opened up about her 'fun' and 'messy' love life as she gave an insight into her romance with Barry (pictured at the Met Gala this month) Saltburn Sabrina Carpenter Olly Alexander BBC Share or comment on this article: Barry Keoghan is every inch the proud boyfriend as he supports Sabrina Carpenter at BBC Radio 1 Big Weekend's live gig e-mail Add comment

The implementation of BookingJiniâs booking engine and revenue management system has been [...]
content: Through this partnership, Tripura Resorts saw revenue surge from INR 49,000 to over INR 5.2 million, with 30% from direct bookings Hyderabadâs only five-star resort, Tripura Resorts, has reported a substantial increase in revenue following the adoption of BookingJiniâs advanced digital solutions. The implementation of BookingJiniâs booking engine and revenue management system has been instrumental in this growth, with revenues soaring from INR 49,000 in the first quarter to over INR 5.2 million by the fifth quarter . Significantly, 30% of this impressive revenue is attributed to direct bookings, highlighting the effectiveness of BookingJiniâs digital strategies in enhancing operational efficiency and profitability. BookingJiniâs innovative solutions included developing Tripura Resortsâ website, seamless integration with Google Business Page and Hotel Center, and proactive online reputation management. With a stellar 4.5-star rating on Google and 580+ reviews in a year, Tripura Resorts saw a surge in direct online bookings, exceeding 200 in the past 12 months. Mr. Pasupuleti Sudhakar, Founder and Managing Director of Tripura Resorts , shared his appreciation, saying, âBookingJiniâs technology and tailored support have been instrumental in our achievements. Their innovative strategies and all-encompassing solutions have not only boosted our revenue but also established us as a distinguished 5-star property in Hyderabad.â Ms. Namrata Swain, VP â Growth, BookingJini stated, âTechnology is making things easier for everyone in the hospitality industry. At BookingJini, our goal is to help businesses grow. Seeing Tripura Resorts double their revenue with our digital solutions is exactly what we aim for. We strive to increase direct bookings and boost ROI for our clients.â BookingJiniâs channel manager has streamlined the management of bookings across major Online Travel Agency Platforms, resulting in enhanced digital visibility and impressive ratings on platforms like Agoda, Goibibo, and MakeMyTrip.

title: Alpine Start Development Announces Commencement of New Apartment Community: Alpine Fossil Creek
creator: PRNewswire

content: Loading... Loading... Marking the Developer's fourth project in DFW and first in Haltom City, Texas DALLAS , May 28, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Alpine Start Development (ASD), a family-owned real estate development and investment firm, is thrilled to announce the start of its first apartment development in Haltom City , " Alpine Fossil Creek". This new apartment community features 296-units within three-story garden-style buildings situated on 15.6 acres, overlooking Big Fossil Creek. The community is just a 10-minute drive to downtown Fort Worth, and across the street from Haltom City High School. "This is more than just the start of construction. It represents a long, shared vision between Alpine Start, the City, and our partners. We are honored to be a part of bringing this vision to life. This project is a testament to what can be achieved when dedicated partners come together with a unified goal of creating something special," said Jacobe Chandler , SVP of Alpine Start Development . "We are excited to debut our first development in Haltom City , a coveted market we've targeted for years. Residents can expect top-tier resort-style amenities and unmatched convenience thanks to the development's prime location. Our team's thoughtful approach toward programming indoor and outdoor amenity spaces will bring a unique residential experience to this submarket. This site has unique, irreplaceable attributes â including a creek-side walking trail on Big Fossil Creek that runs year-round and adjacency to the newly constructed Haltom High School . The landscape will allow us to seamlessly integrate nature walks along Big Fossil Creek, fostering a connection with the community and environment. Partnering with Haltom City to bring this project into construction has been a great experience, and we look forward to a thriving collaboration to bring this project to life," said David Eitches , Managing Partner of Alpine Start Development. Situated on approximately 15.6 acres in Haltom City , Alpine Fossil Creek takes advantage of the site's natural landscape to deliver an exceptional resident experience. The project boasts an impressive array of amenities, including a resort-style pool, an expansive courtyard, a well-equipped fitness center, multiple walking trails, outdoor seating with creek views, a massive clubhouse, grilling stations, and access to fishing. The Alpine property will offer a comprehensive and inviting living experience, differentiated from offerings at other communities. In addition to being situated on Big Fossil Creek and one block from Haltom High School , there are plans for new hotels and restaurants, along with a new H-Mart high-end supermarket, within walking distance to the site. The community's tenants will have access to Loop 820 within a few minutes of leaving the property â making it highly convenient to commute to downtown Fort Worth , Alliance, Arlington , and Irving . Alpine Fossil Creek meets the surging demand for housing in this supply-constrained submarket, making it a valuable addition to the community. "This project represents a shared vision between Alpine Start Development, Haltom City , and our partners. We value working with municipalities with a clear vision for their housing policy. Those standards provide insight into designing projects that meet the city's objectives and allow us to deliver new housing stock to under-supplied submarkets. This site in particular has unique, irreplaceable attributes including the perennial creek, rolling topography, adjacency to the newly-constructed Haltom High School and unrivaled highway access â all of which underpins our excitement to invest in the growth of Haltom City ," said Zach Gensior , Managing Partner of Alpine Start Development. The project offers seven different floor plans, including 143 one-bedroom units ranging from 665 to 810 square feet, 129 two-bedroom units ranging from 1,039 to 1,194 square feet, and 24 three-bedroom units ranging from 1,367 square feet. Alpine Start Development anticipates that Alpine Fossil Creek will be completed by early 2026 but will have its first units and the clubhouse available by summer 2025. This development will be Alpine Start Development's fourth ground-up development and seventh acquisition since inception. Alpine Start Development strives to deliver the best renter experience at an attainable price point and takes pride in the thoughtful design of its apartment communities, curated amenity packages, attention to detail, and responsive management to those communities. To view renderings of Alpine Fossil Creek and high resolution images of the Alpine Fossil Creek ground breaking, please click here: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/khplmlw8pnta61g9s31xd/AN784EaF7SH7w99L9-pa5HE?rlkey=kruf0haqvgaabpetquw1ty3l6&st=sytltcbx&dl=0 . About Alpine Start Development Alpine Start Development is a family-owned Dallas -based real estate development and investment firm that has gained recognition for its commitment to creating top-quality apartment communities in North and Central Texas . With a strong emphasis on thoughtful design and responsive management, Alpine Start Development aims to deliver the best possible rental experience to its residents. SOURCE Alpine Start Development Loading... Loading...
